The Radar Screen will display BluTracker in a Radar type Screen. Of course, because we don't really know direction, the radar Screen can only be used to approximate the relative distance of the BluTracker to your phone, but not direction. So once you have located on the Radar Screen a BluTracker you would like to find, you start walking in a specific direction, and see if it gets closer or farther.
 



Water Resistant, No- ON/OFF button!

 
 
The battery last for about 2 months with continuous use. That means you can attach it to your Pets collar, and literally forget about it. Or Attach it to a kids sneaker, bag pack etc.
 
 
When the battery is low, it takes about 1 hour to fully charge it!

So many use cases...

 
Get an Alert if someone is moving your bike. 
But, where did you park it? BluTracker will  help you find it too.
 
 
Don't loose your Bike!
 

 
 
 
Know where your workers are. 
 
 
 
 
 
 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 

 
 
 
 
 
 
BluTracker has a Motion Detector. Get an alert on your phone, if someone touches your stuff.
 

What about an API? We will release an API for BluTracker soon after launch! You can make your own custom apps for BluTracker.
Our API will support iOS, Android, Mac OS X, and Windows 8.

Preorder your BluTracker now, and get the early bird price.


You can have one BluTracker or 20. Your phone can find them all. 

Requirements: 

iOS devices with Bluetooth 4.0 (iPhone 4s, iPhone 5, new iPad, New Touch, mini iPad) 
Android devices supporting Bluetooth Low Energy, running Android 4.0 and newer. We have tested it with Samsung S3, and Note 2. We will post more phones tested as we finish the Android app.
Specs:


Technology: Bluetooth 4.0 (Bluetooth Low Energy) 

Range: US Version Approximate 2500 Feet with line of sight, European Version 120 Meters with line of sight. Customer sets the range based on the location BluTracker is being used.

Battery: Lasts up-to 2 Months with continuous use. Battery is rechargeable. Takes about 1 hour to fully re-charge it.
Water Resistant.
GPS Sirf IV Engine
Operation temperature range: 15°F (-10°c) to 150°F (65°c).
 
Size and weight of each BluTracker: 1.62 Inches x 1.6 Inches x 0.65 Thickness  (41.5mm x 41mm x 16.6mm Thickness) Weight: 0.57 ounces (16 grams)

FAQ:
What is the difference between the US Version and the European version.

It is the same unit. When you set up your unit for the first time, to meet European laws and Certification, selecting Europe as your location will load the EU profile. The US profile transmits a stronger signal than the European one. To meet European CE and ETSI Certification, we had to lower the transmission signal for the European profile. For the US Profile we meet the maximum allowance per FCC Title 47, Section 15.247.
How many BluTrackers can 1 Smartphone find?

We recommend using no more than 20 BluTrackers at the same time.
Can multiple phones connect to a BluTracker?

You can pair a Blutracker to many phones, and even see all the BluTrackers in range on the Radar screen from many phones at the same time, but only one phone can make connect to a BluTracker. (make it Buzz, or create the Virtual Leash at a time)
Is the signal with coordinates being transmitted from the BluTracker encrypted?

BluTracker encrypts the signal, and only a phone that was paired with BluTracker will be able to decode the signal.
What to do if my pet is lost, and I can't locate BluTracker on my phone?

Start walking or driving in any direction. The Blutracker app will keep searching for the BluTracker. You only need to pick up the BluTracker signal very briefly to know its exact last known GPS coordinates.  Once that signal is received, it will pinpoint the location on the BluTracker Map view app. With the US Version we have picked up weak signals as far as 1 mile with direct line of sight.
How easy is to pair a BluTracker to your smartphone?

You only need to pair the BluTracker once with your phone and after that it is automatic. To pair the first time launch the BluTracker app, select to add a new device, then the app will prompt you to scan a barcode or enter the Private key belonging to the BluTracker. You are done.
 What Smartphones does the BluTracker work with?:

BluTracker works iPhone 4s, iPhone 5, New Ipad, iPad mini, New iPod touch. It also works on Android devices supporting Bluetooth Low Energy, running Android 4.0 and newer. We have tested it on the Samsung Galaxy S3, and Note 2, and it works great! (Since the support for Bluetooth 4.0 on the Samsung S3 is bad, we wrote the Bluetooth drivers on our own)
Do I need a separate adapter or special case for my phone?

Nothing special is required. BluTracker will communicate directly with your Smartphone via Bluetooth Low Energy.
What is the Line of sight range of BluTracker?

US Version is Approximate 2500 feet or 0.5 miles.
European Version is approximate 120 Meters.
What is the range of BluTracker when there are buildings or trees between the Smartphone and BluTracker?

US Version is approximate 250-1000 feet.
European Version is approximate 40-80 meters.
How long will the battery last and is it rechargeable?

The included battery inside is rechargeable and lasts about 2 months with continuous use. It charges in about one hour and is ready to use again.
What kind of battery does the BluTracker use?

The BluTracker uses a Li-Polymer rechargeable battery.
Will the BluTracker radar app, show me the indoor direction to my lost object?

Because we don't really know direction, the radar Screen can only be used to approximate the distance of the BluTracker to your phone, but not direction. So once item you are looking for is on your Radar Screen you start walking in a specific direction, and see if it gets closer or farther.
How do you attach a BluTracker to your dog?

BluTracker comes with a rubber-mounting holder, which will attach it to any Pet’s collar. You can also thread in the collar if you prefer not using the rubber holder.
How do you attach a BluTracker to a backpack ?

BluTracker comes key ring, that easily enables it to be connected to any zipper, or fabric loop.
Is the BluTracker water resistant?

Yes, the design of BluTracker is water resistant. This doesn't mean that you can go diving with it. Blutracker will not work underwater.
What type of charger comes with the BluTracker?

BluTracker comes with a USB type cable charger. You can plug it to any computer USB port or USB charger.
PROJECT TIMELINE
We currently have fully working pre-production units. 
Our hardware and software is finalized; our app development is in beta phase now.
We have identified all of the components to be used in mass production and built the latest samples using those components. We have started a pilot production of 100 units.
 
December:

Pre-production run of 50 samples have been completed with T2 off-tooled plastic.
App Development: App Development has started beta phase in mid-December for iOS. 
January:

CES! We will be exhibiting the BluTracker at CES in Las Vegas! Checkout real working units!
Late January Product will be submitted for FCC, CE certifications. This can take about 6 weeks for completion.
App submission to Apple Store for approval.
Android app enters Beta phase.
Setup QC and assembly line in China.
Product testing: We will start in middle of January an extensive 30 day product testing using beta testers. Product will be tested in USA (New York and Florida), Germany, Netherlands, Hong Kong, and China.
Packaging: Retail Packaging will be finalized.
February:

Final adjustment to Electric board, pending Certification results.
Certification completed for BluTracker.
March:

Mass Production, Quality Control
Prepare for Distribution 
April:

Distribution! - Backers get their BluTrackers.
About us
We have been designing, and managing the production of various products for many large companies for the last 12 years. We specialize in very small Bluetooth designs. Many Bluetooth solutions and Bluetooth gadgets sold for cars by large and very known companies in USA are our designs. We also have designed various Health and fitness Bluetooth products currently being sold in retail outlets worldwide. We also have designed and brought to production home environment sensors with Wifi that plug into AC outlets. We have great contacts with many factories in China, and have years of experience getting FCC, CE, Wifi, BT, etc Certifications.
We have a great team of embedded hardware engineers, RF engineers, embedded software engineers, and mechanical engineers.
Use of Funds
We've built our prototypes. We’ve figured out our supply chain. We need your help to take the next step. We’re looking for funds to put BluTracker into production. We know what we’re doing; we've led the development and manufacturing of more than two dozen hardware products for many large companies, so we know exactly what's required to pull this off. You are getting in early and receiving a premium product ahead of everyone else.
 
We’re asking you to help us make BluTracker a reality.

story: ___

Short Summary

Welcome to the next evolution in technology. Hi,  my name is Ron, the inventor of the P.O.D. from NYC. First, I'd like to thank you for visiting and supporting a solution to an on-going and growing demand which we all are facing. I'm sure just like me, every one of you have run out of battery power either on your cell phone or other mobile devices and always at the worst possible time, (like there ever is a good time to run out of power). Today there are so many new apps and mobile devices that we just can’t live without. 

The POD was created to manage all your USB mobile devices so that you will never be without power or have to do anything else except take this handy little device with you. Simply plug your USB cable into the USB port of the POD and it will turn on automatically. The color band will start glowing around the unit and that’s how you know it is working. Once your unit is charged, you simply unplug the USB cable and the glowing power indicator will automatically turn off. 

The POD is a fully maintenance free unit, which means you will never have to charge it for the next 10 years. This unit comes with an adjustable mounting strap that fits all cell phones. With the shape of the POD, it fits perfectly in the palm of your hand giving you a better more comfortable grip, meaning less likelihood of dropping, when mounted to your cell phone. The adjustable strap can also be worn on your wrist, belt loop or  purse strap for your convenience. I added an ultra bright LED flashlight to the front of the POD so you can just tap the light and it goes on, when you tap it again it will go off. I added this because we never have a light when we need it. So enjoy this feature.

Additionally the POD also works on the 1st mobile device... YOUR CAR! That’s right, I said your car. The car battery doesn’t die as fast or as often as other power sources do, but it does die, so if you ever get stuck, you now can stay in the safety of your car and use the POD's Perfect Add-On "Car-Jumpstart Kit". Simply attach the POD, using the CONNECTING CABLE into the CIGARETTE LIGHTER ADAPTER. The Power Meter will show you when the battery is charged. Super simple, Super easy. How cool is that?

Now Compare: Portable Power Units vs. P.O.D.

1)  They get 2x to 4x more battery life.

     POD runs for 10 years. 

2)  They have another device to charge.

     POD is maintenance free

3)  They have you balance two devices in your hand. 

     POD’s adjustable strap secures safely to your cell phone acting as one unit.

4)  Basically they are a battery in a case.

     POD is the next evolution in technology

5)  They require you to find an outlet

    POD needs no electricity to recharge

6)  Cellphone flashlight apps are the #1 source of Malware and Identity theft for        500 million users... POD has a Built-in flashlight and optional Car Jumpstart

POD PRICE $49.95               CAR JUMPSTART KIT (POD not included)  $14.95 

What We Need 

I have two prototypes, a black one and a white one that were made on a 3D printer. In order to be productive, the funds we raise will go towards the Tooling, Molds, Custom Circuit Boards, Die Cuts, any funds over our goal will go to setting up the 1st production run. Our goal is to raise $50,000.00 within the next 30 days. 

Custom POD Orders: Pick a color, texture and add your Logo for promotions, advertising and or give-a-ways. (100 Minimum )  

The Impact

Let's look at the demographics. Who over the age of 5 years old doesn’t have some kind of mobile device? It's Global. We know this technology is a real game changer. Just think of the enhanced productivity that will be possible for so many people.  No more sales people who lose a sale because they ran out of power on an important call.  I am sure that this will even save lives.  Think of the people out hiking who get lost for days and their cell phones run out of power.  Or people trapped in a blizzard and their car battery dies.  And won’t those family car rides be more enjoyable when each of the kids can play their games without getting upset that the batteries died?

 The POD  has a global impact that will benefit lives in remote places and crowded urban areas, including compatibility with GREEN technology as it leaves no carbon footprint, and will even save power that would be used to recharge the batteries of millions of devices. An added benefit is that we will be creating around 300 to 500 jobs within the 1st year right here in America by bringing manufacturing back to the U.S. 

Other Ways You Can Help 

Please join me on this global changing journey. Don't just read this story be a part of it by telling your family, friends, neighbors and co-workers about this campaign. Use the Indiegogo share tools! Get on your FaceBook, Twitter, Linkedin or any other social media and tell everyone you know to do the same. This is a world-wide problem and we have the SOLUTION! Together we can make a difference.

story:
Project Goal

We are trying to raise $200 to cover the upgrade of our Apple iOS developer account to support Enterprise features so we can release Einstein for iOS to the public. Einstein will never be approved by Apple, free or not, and we are out of developer beta test devices to give away.

By upgrading to the Enterprise level we will be free to distribute Einstein directly without going through the app store and apple approval process. As long as we get $200 the project will go through and we can distribute it. If you have any other questions, just ask!

story:
#APD #BOOGOFRAFFLE #BRIDGETHEGAP 




We are Bridging The Gap from Self Employment, Freelance Work and Education to The UK Media Industry Through Smart and Contemporary Networking Opportunities. This event will be taking place in Manchester, in early 2015.

Tip: Bring business cards, and loads of them!



Confirmed Speakers

 

We are proud to offer all guests the opportunity to hear from successful entrepreneurs to well established industry experts, from industries including Film, TV, Radio, Music & Sound. 



Beverages and Canapés  

There will be a variety of alcoholic and soft beverages and delicious canapés available to choose from.



Live Entertainment

The Shady 80's

The Shady 80's are a Manchester based band. Their bandname derives from the fact that all band members are born in the 80s! They have been acknowledged for making contemporary and engaging music for the past year.
Individually they have worked with and opened for the likes of Feeder, Ghetts, Wretch 32, T Rex, and more! As a band they are 'fresh sounding' and bringing next elements and a new sound. With the right Perk, you will receive a signed autograph by The Shady 80's.



The Magic Room Band

The Magic Room Band have expressed interest in performing at our event. This 4 piece blues-rock band, based in Manchester, consists of two Spaniards (Andrés Granadero – vocals & guitar, and Javier Ema – drums) and two Englishmen (Jesse Mills – bass guitar & vocals, and Dan Jones – lead guitar & vocals). Their music is a cross between genuine blues-rock and melodic punk, which make audiences bones shiver and set their hips alive. The Magic Room Band have been very active within Manchester with their performances. Their sound is powerful, catchy and reminiscent of the real rock-and-rollers. Their live performances possess plenty of bravado and creativity. The song-writing is carefully cultivated and structured yet the overall effect and performance is like the wild garden: raw and full of promise. With the right Perk, you will receive a signed autograph by The Magic Room Band.


And more...


What We Need & What You Get

£500 is only the tip of the iceberg. With this, we will be applying for a larger grant from the Arts Council. However we need to raise this initial amount - 10%. We need to cover certain expenses, such as event hire, merchandise, live entertainment, open bar fees and much more, to ensure that our attendees are receiving the most that they can from our event. We aim to maximise this Media Networking Opportunity! In return for your supportive donations, depending on which Perk you choose, you will receive some exciting rewards! Every single donation is greatly appreciated, because they will allow for us to expand and provide more, which will enable us to offer larger opportunities to further help 'Media Rookies' to Professionals network and get from A to B.


    The Purpose & Aim

    We want to help individuals gain the necessary work experience and networking skills, that are vital, in order to the successfully enter the UK Media Industry. Our events are only the first part of our Networking program. Our services will be growing and moving towards virtual solutions such as online webinars, chatrooms and workshop access - all designed to help individuals to create, strengthen and widen their inner circle of contacts within the Media Industry. This event will be the start of new, engaging and futuristic services.

    We are passionate about networking and the positive difference this will have for individuals and companies seeking talent. We are here to help smooth this transition. Providing a positive impact on the British Media Industries as well as helping source new talent who have been left on the sidelines.

    We would love for you to be a part of the change! Help to #BridgeTheGap today!

      Other Ways You Can Help

      We understand that not everyone who is excited about this opportunity can afford to contribute. There are other ways that you can help:

      • Follow us on Twitter & Retweet our Tweets!
      • Follow us on Instagram + keep updated!
      • Tell your friends and family about this Media Networking Opportunity.
      • Share this campaign, via the Indiegogo share tools, and refer your friends and family to support us.

Follow us on Instagram + keep updated!

Tell your friends and family about this Media Networking Opportunity.

Share this campaign, via the Indiegogo share tools, and refer your friends and family to support us.

story:
The MOD-t is an easy-to-use, affordable 3D printer designed for homes and schools. Geoffrey Fowler of the Wall Street Journal calls it “The printer that I recommend for your first foray into 3D.” It’s ready to use right out of the box and doesn’t require any advanced configuring or adjusting to get started. With built-in Wi-Fi and a web-based control system, you can easily operate your MOD-t from your computer, laptop, smartphone, or tablet. The MOD-t is also remarkably quiet, perfect for the classroom or the living room. Combined with a library of hundreds of free designs and a free spool of biodegradable PLA filament, getting started with 3D printing has never been easier.

3D printing should be as easy as how we create and communicate. That’s why New Matter is more than just a printer. It’s an end-to-end 3D printing system, including our award winning MOD-t 3D printer, complimentary software, and a store full of cool 3D-printable designs: the New Matter Store.

                            

The MOD-t uses an ingenious 2-axis motion system that simultaneously moves and supports the build plate with very few components. Translation: It’s breakthrough technology, it prints more consistently, and it makes the printer affordable.

To help make our vision a reality, we teamed up with frog Design. frog has a 43-year history of finding applications for emerging technologies that advance the human experience. Over the past 43 years, they've worked with Apple, Disney, GE, HP, Intel, Microsoft and more. New Matter partnered with frog's team of industrial designers, strategists, mechanical engineers and digital designers to create a killer user experience and smart business strategy for New Matter.

MOD-t Features

  • Affordable

    The MOD-t is one of the most competitively priced 3D printers on the market today.

  • Wi-Fi Enabled

    Select, customize, and print wirelessly from your device.

  • Quiet & Safe

    Clear cover protects your designs and reduces noise.

  • Designed for the Home

    A clean, minimalist design makes the MOD-t ideal for any living space.

  • Eco-Friendly

    Prints with PLA, a consumer and eco-friendly material available in an array of colors



(Click to enlarge)

FAQs

What is 3D printing?

3D printing is a method by which people can create 3D objects from 3D designs through a process called additive manufacturing. Successive layers of material are laid down on top of each other until the object has been created.

What is the MOD-t?

The MOD-t is an easy-to-use, affordable 3D printer designed for homes and schools. It’s ready-to-use right out of the box and doesn’t require any advanced configuring or adjusting to get started. With built-in Wi-Fi and a web-based control system, you can easily operate your MOD-t from your computer, laptop, smartphone, or tablet. The MOD-t is also remarkably quiet, perfect for the back of the classroom or the living room. Combined with a library of hundreds of free designs and compatibility for use with PLA, a biodegradable plastic, getting started with 3D printing has never been easier.

What can you print with the MOD-t?

You can print anything that has a corresponding 3D design and that will fit within the build area. The New Matter Store was created so that users can easily download curated designs on the MOD-t. More advanced users can also upload their own .STL or .OBJ files to print on the MOD-t.

What is the material this printer uses?

The New Matter MOD-t prints in polylactic acid (PLA) . PLA is a benign, environmentally friendly and biodegradable thermoplastic, typically made from renewable sources such as corn or tapioca. PLA is used in a variety of applications from compostable packaging material to medical implants.

Is the printing material safe?

Yes, PLA is a safe material.

Does the MOD-t take standard PLA, or is it cartridge based?

The MOD-t is designed to accept any 1.75mm diameter PLA filament. However, we strongly recommend buying from a reputable source due to the widely varying quality of filament available on the market.

What size PLA filament does the MOD-t take?

1.75mm diameter

What is the resolution quality of the MOD-t?

The resolution is determined by both layer thickness and nozzle diameter. In the horizontal plane, the nozzle diameter (0.4 mm) limits the resolution to approximately 0.5 mm. In the vertical axis, the minimum supported layer thickness is 0.2 mm.

Is the printing material safe?

Yes, PLA is a safe material.

Is the material eco-friendly and can I put it in my recycling bin?

PLA is biodegradable and will, with time, decompose into harmless lactic acid. It is also a recyclable material, with an SPI resin code of 7. Unfortunately, 3D printed objects will not be suitably marked with this code and therefore recycling facilities will be unable to recycle your objects. We hope that, with time and as 3D printing grows in popularity, processes will be developed to allow 3D printed objects to be identified and recycled.

Since PLA is biodegradable, can objects printed with PLA be used to store or serve food?

While PLA has been used for professionally manufactured food storage and service containers, we do not recommend that you use your 3D printed objects for this purpose. We found this blog article to be particularly informative. 

How much power does the MOD-t use?

The maximum power the MOD-t consumes is 80 Watts, however the average power usage will be substantially below that. In other words, it's about like a laptop computer.

How long will it take to print something?

Build time depends entirely on the object being built, and can be affected by factors such as object size, chosen layer resolution, level of detail in the object, and infill type (solid, hollow, or partially filled). Typical build times can be as short as 30 minutes for relatively small objects to several hours or more for large objects.

Which of my devices will work with the MOD-t

The MOD-t is operated via a browser-based interface accessible through most modern and updated desktop and mobile browsers: Mac OSX 10.7+, Windows 7+ (required for setup only).

What’s the nozzle diameter, build volume, print speed, etc..?

See the technical specs above.

Is the bed removable?

Yes! Our unique motion system allows the print bed to be simply lifted out of the printer when you need to remove an object or prepare the bed for building your next object. To reinstall, simply place the bed onto the drive rods.

Does the printer have auto-leveling?
Because the MOD-t’s unique mechanism slide the build plate across the drive rods at a consistent height, bed leveling is completely unnecessary.

What about build plate calibration and zeroing?
The MOD-t performs automatic feedback based centering and homing at the start of each print to position the build plate and ensure the first layer will go down correctly every time.

Where can I buy the MOD-t?

You can purchase the MOD-t at one of several locations:

·  http://www.NewMatter.com

·  http://www.BestBuy.com

·  http://www.ToysRUs.com

·  http://www.Amazon.com

·  A Micro Center location near you

How much does the PLA filament used in the MOD-t cost?

1-kg spools of PLA are priced at $29.99 while 0.5-kg spools of PLA are $19.99. We offer a variety of colors including Midnight Black, Sky Blue, Chestnut Brown, Gold Rush, Slate Gray, Green Meadow, Natural, Tropic Orange, Royal Purple, Red Pepper, Polar White, Solar Yellow, and New Matter Pink.

What is the New Matter Store?

The New Matter Store is a library of highly curated, print-ready 3D designs, allowing users without 3D design experience to find amazing designs to build with their MOD-t. If you’re a 3D designer, you can make money selling your designs through the New Matter Store. It’s a fully integrated marketplace designed to work seamlessly with the MOD-t.

What kind of content will be on the New Matter Store?

We’re working with a number of well-known 3D designers and content owners to feature their work on our marketplace. Boasting hundreds of 3D printable designs ranging from the artistic to the practical, print categories include: Fashion, Hobbies, Home, Pets, Toys and much more. The New Matter Store is the premiere online destination for high-quality, curated designs from today’s most influential 3D design artists.

Do you have any discounts for schools or teachers?

Discounts are available for teachers, administrators and school districts who want to purchase directly as well. Educators can choose between two packages: Get Started with the 3D Printing Pack (1 MOD-t 3D Printer, 3 spools of 1 kg filament, 3 extra print surface plates) or the Create Your Own MakerSpace Pack (3 MOD-t printers, 15 spools of 1 kg filament, 15 extra print surface plates). We also offer a discount on the MOD-t for educators interested in a custom order. To learn more, go to www.newmatter.com/education.

Looking for even more details about the MOD-t? Check out the New Matter Blog for tips, tricks, guides and latest updates about the MOD-t.
story_txt:
The MOD-t is an easy-to-use, affordable 3D printer designed for
homes and schools. Geoffrey Fowler of the Wall Street Journal calls it “The
printer that I recommend for your first foray into 3D.” It’s ready to use right
out of the box and doesn’t require any advanced configuring or adjusting to get
started. With built-in Wi-Fi and a web-based control system, you can easily
operate your MOD-t from your computer, laptop, smartphone, or tablet. The MOD-t
is also remarkably quiet, perfect for the classroom or the living room.
Combined with a library of hundreds of free designs and a free spool of
biodegradable PLA filament, getting started with 3D printing has never been easier.


    3D printing should be as easy as how we create and communicate. That’s why New Matter is more than just a printer. It’s an end-to-end 3D printing system, including our award winning MOD-t 3D printer, complimentary software, and a store full of cool 3D-printable designs: the New Matter Store.                            The MOD-t uses an ingenious 2-axis motion system that simultaneously moves and supports the build plate with very few components. Translation: It’s breakthrough technology, it prints more consistently, and it makes the printer affordable.To help make our vision a reality, we teamed up with frog Design. frog has a 43-year history of finding applications for emerging technologies that advance the human experience. Over the past 43 years, they've worked with Apple, Disney, GE, HP, Intel, Microsoft and more. New Matter partnered with frog's team of industrial designers, strategists, mechanical engineers and digital designers to create a killer user experience and smart business strategy for New Matter.MOD-t Features

Affordable
The MOD-t is one of the most competitively priced 3D printers on the market today.


Wi-Fi Enabled
Select, customize, and print wirelessly from your device.


Quiet & Safe
Clear cover protects your designs and reduces noise.


Designed for the Home
A clean, minimalist design makes the MOD-t ideal for any living space.


Eco-Friendly
Prints with PLA, a consumer and eco-friendly material available in an array of colors


(Click to enlarge)

is 3D printing?3D printing
is a method by which people can create 3D objects from 3D designs through a
process called additive manufacturing. Successive layers of material are laid
down on top of each other until the object has been created.

is the MOD-t?The MOD-t is

never been easier.

story:
About The Developer

American developer, Noel Brown,  is a technical college graduate mastering in carpentry and building trade.  He is the owner and CEO of a small management company KINGS REALTY MANAGEMENT LLC. Mr. Brown is a proud father of five, of which one is now attending graduate school, another still in college, two in high school and his baby girl.

He has always wanted to create something to assist people in the way todays life is managed – efficiently, productively and filled with fun.  Mr. Brown has teamed up for the development of this project with Zapporoo to transform his idea into a marketable platform. Mr. Brown feels passionately about his app and believes in the positive impact it will have in any market that it is promoted.

 About The App

The name of the app is FIRST COM FIRST SERVE. Mr. Brown’s app allows its users the ability to search all websites, locate whatever the user is looking for, find the best price and contact the user by Facebook, Instagram, or Twitter when the product becomes available.  Also this app provides the unique feature of tracking sales and notification of availability by email, text, and robo calls.

This app is a search engine that is like no other.  For its users – consumers, entrepreneurs and business minded people - this app will take away the constant signing in and searching for deals on products and sales. The app will be able to text the user on the search status. For those who prefer just a phone call, the app will feature Robo call. This will enable the user to program any cell or landline number to which the app can  track sales or notify of product availability.

What Problems Does It Solve

The unique features of this app will provide the following benefits for all consumers:
• Allows the user to track sales and locate products at the best price
• Gives the user the ability to receive the product desired as soon as it is available
• Is a time saving product, eliminating unnecessary searches


Thank you for taking the time to review my  new Smart Phone App. Thank you for your funding and please share this campaign with others.

story:
What is PLANiT?

PLANiT is a mobile solution designed to make interacting with other people offline, simple. A platform designed specifically to create, share, and explore upcoming events at your location or in your social network. 

When trying to do anything with other people physically around us or in our social circles we're often left with very few options for exploration or coordination.

Texting… Texting someone to make plans is a hassle, and the information you get is completely dependent on what that person tells you. Group texting to set up rides, pick-up basketball games, meetings, and get together is cumbersome. And when it comes to social discovery, no one wants to send out that desperate mass “What’s going on tonight” text to all their friends.

Emailing… Very similar to texting , emailing often encounters the “volley phenomenon” where you must go back and forth successfully to iron out details.

Facebook/Twitter..  Social media sites do an amazing job of harnessing the power of the internet to allow users from all over the world to connect and share thoughts, ideas, and opinions. But trying to find something to do on a Saturday night on Twitter or Facebook inevitably leads to a night scrolling on the couch.

Google..   Searching the web for something to do often times has limited result due to lack of webpages dedicated to broadcasting opportunities for physical interaction. Google calendar is not a social platform for sharing and promoting events, and Google+.. Is well…they should’ve stuck to Search & email.

Why do people need it?

Smart phones are built for fulfilling two main customer needs; communication (texting, calling, emailing) and exploration (internet, social media) and PLANiT maximizes the utility of these functions. Whether it’s keeping better track of your daily schedule, meeting some friends for lunch, or exploring your city’s night life for something to do – PLANiT does it all.

And to those who argue that smart phones are also for sharing pictures, videos, and documents…we agree. PLANiT will be updating to adopt those features after our launch!

 

Screens

The PLANiT experience begins with seamless registration from day one. Just fill in email and password for an account and optional info for friends and family to find you more easily.

 

Home screen offers instant access to everything going on in your life right now. Quickly see commitments for your day, week and month or add an event, all with the touch of a finger.

 

 

The Beacon Feed is a live stream of shared upcoming events from people you are connected to.

 

You can check out all the screens our wonderful development team put together here:

http://mockup.io/#projects/100003

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

We have put over $30,000 into the development of the app so far and we are looking for an additional $25,000 to continue developing and bring attention to our mission.

All funds raised here will aid in our collaborative effort with the professional developers Yalantis, a unique and proven talent that has made over 100 apps, with millions of downloads worldwide, feel free to check out their work at Yalantis.com. We would also use some of the funds for a trip to Ukraine to visit and collaborate in house with them before the launch, as well as discuss plans for a European launch and Marketing Campaign.

For donations, we are offering a variety of rewards, each of which will not only express our gratitude for your support, but also give you the ability to be recognized as the earliest adopter of the next biggest mobile app!

Rewards include –

  • Thank You Letter
  • Access to Beta version (from which you can invite your friends to gain the full experience)
  • Feedback survey to give valuable input on features and future updates
  • T Shirt
  • Cinch Bag
  • iPhone Case
  • Promotional Space on our Explore Page. This is where businesses and organizations will feature events and special occasions to reach audiences at the Local, City, State, Nationwide, and Worldwide scale
    • 28 days featured profile or 7 days featured event at the
      • City level ~ $50
      • State level ~ $100
      • The National Level ~ $1000
  • Opportunity to meet the founders, grab lunch, and join in on one of our Think Tank sessions
  • If our high expectations are met, future invitations to PLANiT launch party (champagne, tuxedos, limousines, organic chefs) 

 

The Impact

We will use this app to ease the life of every individual smartphone user on the planet. With over 1 billion people using a device we see smartphones as the future for mankind to explore and connect with one another.

The explosion of social media has formed communities of people that can interact and help each other just like a real community. PLANiT will take this to the next level to bring people together in the real world anywhere from a personal appointment or local game to worldwide movements like the Olympics.

Not only do we need to create a brilliant application but also a rich and active community to populate and generate the content that will bring its far-reaching utility. To do this, PLANiT will be absolutely free; we even strongly protect your privacy, maintaining this as s tool free of government or Wall Street control.

We know that with a little spark we can create a free and sustainable model to digitize this space and make all of our lives a hell of a lot easier. The world we live in is one that is deeply concerned with Time-Value, and PLANiT is the only solution of its kind to save you time and include all the tools you need to manage your offline life.

 

About Us

Our team is a group of long-time friends trying to use entrepreneurship and philanthropy to better the world. This idea sprouted one summer ago when we found that there was no easy way to schedule frequent soccer games with our peers. We found that all forms of communication (texting, calling, emailing, social media) were way too cumbersome for coordinating real world get-togethers between people. When we returned to school in the fall, we were anxiously pitching our idea and looking for mentorship through the University when a Senior Marketing Student saw the potential in our idea, and invested $25,000 so that we could begin production with the professionals at Yalantis. Shortly after, we stumbled upon Bitcoin, and, realizing the financial and ideological advantage behind it, invested to expand our budget to nearly double what we had started with. The past few months have been spent developing, as well as refining the concept and strategizing for a viral marketing campaign. Our team is excited to release this app to the world, as we know it will be the next great tool for communication and interaction, and any contribution you can make will help!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to help us monetarily, all we can ask is that you spread the word and follow @ourPLANiT on Twitter for updates. And of course be sure to download the free app when it is released in August 2013! :-)

story:
Wouldn't it be awesome to have a full Raspberry Pi based computer in your pocket?

The Raspberry Pi has revolutionized the maker community and the world of DIY computing. But once you add on all the other pieces needed to turn it into a usable computer, you usually end up with either a bunch of separate components connected with cables and wires, or a rather big and clunky box (for most integrated solutions).

What's been missing is a compact, integrated Raspberry Pi based handheld computer, comparable to a modern mobile phone.

Until now.

I've been thinking about such a device for a while, and started working on one last year. After many designs, redesigns and prototypes, the Noodle Pi is finally ready to bring computing freedom to your pocket!

Say Hello to Noodle Pi

Noodle Pi integrates a Raspberry Pi Zero, a high-resolution multi-touch screen, a battery, a power management system, and a camera, all in a super compact device that's good to go anywhere. 

Noodle Pi integrates a beautiful high resolution 3.5" capacitive touchscreen with 800x480 pixels at ~270 PPI, 18-bit color (262,144 colors), and a 60 FPS frame rate.

Noodle Pi also integrates the Raspberry Pi Camera Module v2, for up to 8MP still photos, and 1080p30 / 720p60 / VGA90 video.

Noodle Pi is powered by an internal 500mAh battery. It can be charged via a regular micro-USB charging socket, and there's a red LED to provide a low battery warning.

Strong, Slim, Unibody Design

Noodle Pi's unibody shell is strong and light, with an innovative design that leverages the unique capabilities of 3D printing.

This enables Noodle Pi to pack six separate components, plus connecting wires, into a tiny 93mm x 60mm x 10mm/19mm package. Yes, part of it is only 10mm thick! (The iPhone SE, in comparison, is 7.6mm; the official Pi Zero case is 13mm).

Noodle Pi puts those extra few millimeters to good use. It provides full access to the Pi Zero's USB-OTG and Mini-HDMI ports, so it can be used both as a pocket computer and as a desktop computer. As well as in other configurations. The possibilities are endless!

Despite its super compact size, Noodle Pi is surprisingly strong and sturdy. It feels like a solid, integrated device when you hold it in your hand, not very different from a $900 iPhone.

And, it's available in Jet Black! ;-)

Escape The Walled Garden

Unlike iOS and Android devices, which force you to develop apps in only specific programming languages in a restrictive environment, a Noodle Pi is a full GNU/Linux computer. So you can write apps for it in any language you like.

And once you've written an app for Noodle Pi, you can just release it to the world right away. No need to wait weeks or months for approval to be listed in an app store.

Noodle Pi offers a long overdue escape from the walled gardens mobile computing has been stuck in. It's the mobile device built on free software, reusable components and open platforms. The way computing was meant to be!

One More Thing: Noodle Air

Noodle Pi can be built in two configurations - either using a Pi Zero W, in which case it's a fully connected computer with WiFi and Bluetooth, or using a Pi Zero v1.3, which doesn't include wireless networking capabilities.

When built using a Pi Zero v1.3, it's a whole different gizmo, the Noodle Air, so named because it's an "air-gapped" mobile PC. Noodle Air is effectively invulnerable to snooping or attack over the Internet, as the device doesn't (and cannot, without external hardware) connect to any networks.

In these days of pervasive surveillance and malware, an indispensable piece of kit everyone needs is an air-gapped computer that is never connected to any networks. Noodle Air is that computer.

A Noodle Air enables easy and cost-effective air-gapped security for password storage, crypto-currency cold-storage, secure backups, private notes and photos, and so on. Just be sure never to connect it to any networks, and to keep your MicroSD card physically secure at all times.

One Device, Unlimited Users

In fact, because the Noodle Pi runs entirely off the MicroSD card, a single Noodle Pi or Noodle Air can easily be securely shared by any number of people. Everyone just keeps their own private system on their own MicroSD card.

This enables libraries, schools, etc. to provide shared access to devices that many people can use without compromising privacy or security.

Accessories

I've developed a number of accessories for Noodle Pi as well. They are:

  • Splash-Resistant Case
  • Belt Holster
  • Clip Holster
  • Noodle Key Micro - Micro Keyboard + Touchpad Dock
  • Noodle Key Micro+ - Alternate Micro Keyboard + Touchpad Dock
  • Noodle Key Mini - Mini Keyboard + Touchpad Dock
  • Noodlendo NES game controller dock
  • Noodle Wrist watch strap dock

More details on some of these:

The Noodle Key Micro dock enables docking the Noodle Pi with a tiny RF keyboard and touchpad. I made sure to select a backlit mini-keyboard for the Noodle Key Micro, so you can keep working in low light conditions. The keyboard is readily available on Amazon.

The Noodle Key Micro docked with a micro-keyboard+touchpad makes all the difference when you don't want to waste precious screen space on an on-screen keyboard, and want to work fast. Perfect for writing code or articles on your Noodle Pi, or administering servers using ssh.

Noodle Key Micro holds the Noodle Pi secure while docked, and easily disconnects from the Noodle Pi and the keyboard when not needed. It's tiny, light, and easy to carry around in a pocket, just like the Noodle Pi and the mini keyboard.

After using a prototype Noodle Pi with the micro-keyboard Noodle Key Micro dock for a while, I realized that although it's perfect for quick on-the-go sysadmin things, it's not quite optimal when you want to write text or code really fast. So for that, there's now the Noodle Key Mini dock! 

The Noodle Key Mini docks with a folding bluetooth keyboard+trackpad (readily available on Amazon) which, when folded, isn't much bigger than the smaller micro-keyboard+touchpad, yet folds out to a very reasonably sized keyboard that's perfectly suited for working at full speed.

How awesome is that?

But hey.. it's not all work in Noodle Pi land. When all the sysadmin stuff has been taken care of, and all the code, documentation and articles have been committed to their repositories, it's time to let the hair down and shoot up some aliens!

That's when we pop on the Noodlendo dock!

And here's one more awesome accessory: the Noodle Wrist watch strap dock! Just attach your favorite 22mm watch strap and wear Noodle Pi on your wrist!

There's also one more important accessory: an HDMI Ribbon Cable. You'll need this if you want to use the HDMI output on Noodle Pi. The space around the connector is very restricted and regular HDMI cables will not fit there.

Some Assembly Required

Noodle Pi is a DIY computer. You have to put it together yourself. This is easy and fun to do, and takes about half an hour. No soldering required. You don't even need a screwdriver.

You can also take Noodle Pi apart just as easily, which means you can swap in replacement parts or upgraded components at any time. So when the next version of the Pi Zero is released you will just be able to swap in the new Pi Zero (as long as its shape / size is the same, which is most likely), and upgrade your Noodle Pi in a few minutes!

The Noodle Pi kit includes all the parts you need to put the computer together, except the electronic components and battery. You will need to purchase these components from the sources listed below.

If you'd like a complete pre-assembled Noodle Pi you can pre-order one from the Noodle Pi website.

These are the parts you'll need to buy:

1. Raspberry Pi Zero and Pi Camera Module v2. These are available from many sources. A full list of distributors can be found here. Both Pimoroni and Adafruit (who manufacture some of the other components needed) also sell the Pi Zero and the Camera Module. 

Adafruit: Pi Zero + camera bundles

Pimoroni: Pi Zero or Pi Zero W and Camera

2. Pimoroni HyperPixel PIM297 Display

[UPDATE 08.2018 - NOTE that Pimoroni has discontinued the PIM297 HyperPixel 3.5" display needed to assemble Noodle Pi. The new PIM370 HyperPixel 4.0 display is not compatible with the Noodle Pi kit. You may still be able to find the odd HyperPixel 3.5" display on eBay. I will update this page when I have a new version of Noodle Pi ready for launch. You can also subscribe to the Noodle Pi mailing list, from http://noodlepi.com/mailinglist.]

3. Adafruit 500mA LiPo Battery

4. Adafruit PowerBoost 1000C

5. Pimoroni Hammer Header (Male) with Installation Jig. Both Pimoroni and Adafruit sell this.

You'll also need a hammer to install the hammer header onto the Pi Zero. And a flush wire cutter (a nail clipper will also work) to clip the header pins on the underside of the Pi Zero so they don't stick out from the board too much.

If you're happy to solder on a regular header you could do that instead, or course. The hammer header is just a lot easier and faster to install.

Pi Supply now also sells Pi Zero Ws with pre-soldered-on headers. If you get one of these you don't need the hammer header, or the hammer.

Everything else you need to put the Noodle Pi together will be in the kit. That will include: the shell, a mini on/off switch, a few more important parts, a pre-folded pi zero camera cable, a micro-USB-OTG adapter, and details on how to put everything together. 

Featured On

                                Click here for Press Kit

 

Noodle Pi was recently reviewed and featured on two episodes of The Lunduke Show, which you can watch below.

Noodle Pi Review:

Comparison of five hand-held Linux devices:

 

History

I've been working on building a practical GNU/Linux wearable computer for over 17 years, so this is quite a long story.

Originally, the main motivation was to be able to work (i.e. write code, documentation, etc.) more comfortably and more hours in a day. I wanted to be able to work equally comfortably while standing, sitting or lying down, or walking around. And also to have a fully functional computer on me at all times.

A wearable computer with a head-mounted display (HMD), running a free OS such as GNU/Linux or OpenBSD sounded like just the thing I needed, so that was the goal.

Sometime around year 2000 I installed GNU/Linux on a Compaq iPaq, and that was my first GNU/Linux handheld. I used it a lot, for all sorts of work, while traveling in the Himalayas and connecting to the 'net over dialup from pay phones (known as "PCOs" in India).

My first working wearable with an HMD was in 2001, a Sony VAIO Picturebook hooked up to a Daeyang CyVisor, which I later sawed in half to make a monocular display, so I could still see my surroundings while wearing it.

The Picturebook's video output wasn't directly compatible with the CyVisor, so I also had to throw in a KVM switch in there which fixed the VGA output for the CyVisor. The input device was a Twiddler, which didn't come in a USB version at the time, so there were more cables and adapters to convert from PS/2 to USB.

All those cables and separate components went in a slim Rollerblade backpack. It ended up looking a bit like HP's new wearable workstation. The batteries on the Picturebook and the CyVisor didn't last long, so it wasn't the most usable system. Nevertheless, I did use it quite a bit. I remember using it to work on code while accompanying a friend grocery shopping in Montreal.

It didn't take long for me to come to the conclusion that HMD technology had a ways to go and so I spent much of the next decade using small GNU/Linux and OpenBSD handhelds, primarily the Sharp Zaurus SL-C3x00 and Nokia N800 and N810. When the iPhone came out I was a late adopter (didn't get one till 2009) because the Zaurus and N810 had higher resolution screens and ran GNU/Linux / OpenBSD.

I did keep trying different HMDs over the years, including the Xybernaut Poma (which ran WinCE - horrible! only use I had for it was to read PDFs and VNC out to a real machine), the super-difficult-to-get-hold-of TacEye LT (more on that below), the Micro-Optical MD-6, and the Sony Glasstron PLM-S700E, which still feels like something from the future!

Eventually, I did get an iPod Touch, and then an iPhone. I still held on to my Zaurus for emergency sysadmin work on the go, and got many new tiny laptops from Fujitsu and Sony, and a Nokia N9, an N900 and an N950.

But none of these quite hit the spot. The iPhone was a huge step forward in wearable computers, with its revolutionary touch interface, but also a huge step back, being a walled garden, and closed off to most free software tools. Nokia had an awesome GNU/Linux based platform that could really have taken over the world, but Nokia decided to self-destruct. And the Zaurus, although the most usable of the lot, was still too small and fiddly, and didn't have backlit keys or built-in WiFi or Bluetooth.

Then in 2012 I got a Raspberry Pi. I also had a Tac-Eye LT by then, so of course I immediately created a Pi-based wearable with the two. The Pi outputs HDMI, and the Tac-Eye LT uses VGA, so some more adapters had to be researched and tested, and eventually one worked.

This was the smallest HMD-equipped wearable I'd made till then. But it still wasn't that practical. And my Pi had trouble using multiple USB devices at the same time. It seemed to be a common issue with 1st gen Pis.

Some of the variations of this wearable (photos below) allowed for hot-swappable external batteries, so they could be used uninterrupted for any length of time without needing to be tethered to an AC outlet. This was something I'd sorely missed in my Picturebook based wearable. 

Happy to say, Noodle Pi provides this ability too. Thanks to its internal battery and 5V charging, it can be charged via small external USB battery packs which can be hot-swapped as needed to achieve unlimited mobile battery life.

In 2014 I got a Google Glass XE, and although it ran a horribly old and limited version of Android, it was a massive leap forward in terms of size, weight, and ergonomics. It's natively not much more useful than the WinCE based Xybernaut Poma (except for being a much better GoPro than a GoPro) so I immediately installed a VNC app and hacked up a connection to the Zaurus. And that was my first OpenBSD wearable with an HMD.

But a software update removed Glass's ability to use a bluetooth keyboard and mouse, and again my plans were thwarted! (This functionality is back in the latest Glass software update, so I plan to give it another go soon). Another problem with the Google Glass is that it gets pretty hot while you're wearing it. I worry about the radiation it may be frying my brain with. Plus it's super expensive and not easy to carry around.

All those problems were solved by a revolutionary Kickstarter in 2015 - Vufine. Their monocular HMD does everything right - it's just an HMD, with a small integrated battery, and no integrated underpowered, overpriced, overheating computer. And HDMI input so you can hook up any computer, including a little Pi or a Pi Zero!

I backed it immediately, and as soon as I had my Vufine, I started prototyping various wearables with it. In late 2014 I'd also resumed work on an old idea for end-to-end provably unsnoopable messaging that I had back in the early 2000s, but had put on hold. When I resumed work on this in 2014, I thought I'd write it as an iOS app, but when I tried to learn iOS programming I found it extremely tedious, and I also wasn't so keen on the idea of having to get my app approved by Apple (and the possibility of it not being approved).

But there didn't seem any other option, so I kept trying to learn iOS programming, which was made problematic by the fact that XCode and iOS kept going through compatibility-breaking updates, and then my MacBook Air had a malfunction and had to go in for repairs, and of course you can't code an iOS app on anything other than a Mac.

Then in July 2016 I had another idea.. what if I made a Raspberry Pi based handheld? Then I could write my Unsnoopable app in Perl, my preferred programming language!

And that's when Noodle Pi was conceived. I worked on a number of prototypes, which used various touchscreen displays, mostly from Adafruit. I ended up destroying many touchscreens in the process of trying to slim down the device as much as possible.

In December 2016, I realized I could use Noodle Pi for another of my very old on-hold software projects, which I didn't relish trying to write for iOS, and whose fate I was not OK to leave up to Apple's whims. This was HashCash, a digital cash system I've been working on since the late 90s.

Once I realized Noodle Pi would be perfect for HashCash as well, I fired up Emacs, pulled out my dusty old HashCash code, and got to work. The next six months I barely had any time to eat and sleep, between writing HashCash and working on Noodle Pi prototypes.

Finally, in June 2017, I released a beta of HashCash and Unsnoopable, and just around that time I received an email announcing the release of the Pimoroni HyperPixel display. A quick look at the specs revealed this would be the perfect screen for Noodle Pi, but by the time I got to Pimoroni's site the display had already sold out! I clicked to be notified when it was back in stock, and I was, but it sold out again within a few hours, and I had to wait for it to come back into stock a second time before I could get hold of a few of them.

A few days later the displays finally arrived, and after another multi-week storm of redesigning and prototyping (I was literally designing prototypes in my dreams while sleeping!) I held a fully functional, awesome Noodle Pi in my hand!

As you can too. Order yours now!

Wouldn't it be awesome to have a full Raspberry Pi based computer in your pocket?The Raspberry Pi has revolutionized the maker community and the world of DIY computing. But once you add on all the other pieces needed to turn it into a usable computer, you usually end up with either a bunch of separate components connected with cables and wires, or a rather big and clunky box (for most integrated solutions).What's been missing is a compact, integrated Raspberry Pi based handheld computer, comparable to a modern mobile phone.Until now.I've been thinking about such a device for a while, and started working on one last year. After many designs, redesigns and prototypes, the Noodle Pi is finally ready to bring computing freedom to your pocket!Say Hello to Noodle PiNoodle Pi integrates a Raspberry Pi Zero, a high-resolution multi-touch screen, a battery, a power management system, and a camera, all in a super compact device that's good to go anywhere. Noodle Pi integrates a beautiful high resolution 3.5" capacitive touchscreen with 800x480 pixels at ~270 PPI, 18-bit color (262,144 colors), and a 60 FPS frame rate.Noodle Pi also integrates the Raspberry Pi Camera Module v2, for up to 8MP still photos, and 1080p30 / 720p60 / VGA90 video.Noodle Pi is powered by an internal 500mAh battery. It can be charged via a regular micro-USB charging socket, and there's a red LED to provide a low battery warning.Strong, Slim, Unibody DesignNoodle Pi's unibody shell is strong and light, with an innovative design that leverages the unique capabilities of 3D printing.This enables Noodle Pi to pack six separate components, plus connecting wires, into a tiny 93mm x 60mm x 10mm/19mm package. Yes, part of it is only 10mm thick! (The iPhone SE, in comparison, is 7.6mm; the official Pi Zero case is 13mm).Noodle Pi puts those extra few millimeters to good use. It provides full access to the Pi Zero's USB-OTG and Mini-HDMI ports, so it can be used both as a pocket computer and as a desktop computer. As well as in other configurations. The possibilities are endless!Despite its super compact size, Noodle Pi is surprisingly strong and sturdy. And HDMI input so you can hook up any computer, including a little Pi or a Pi Zero!I backed it immediately, and as soon as I had my Vufine, I started prototyping various wearables with it. In late 2014 I'd also resumed work on an old idea for end-to-end provably unsnoopable messaging that I had back in the early 2000s, but had put on hold. When I resumed work on this in 2014, I thought I'd write it as an iOS app, but when I tried to learn iOS programming I found it extremely tedious, and I also wasn't so keen on the idea of having to get my app approved by Apple (and the possibility of it not being approved).But there didn't seem any other option, so I kept trying to learn iOS programming, which was made problematic by the fact that XCode and iOS kept going through compatibility-breaking updates, and then my MacBook Air had a malfunction and had to go in for repairs, and of course you can't code an iOS app on anything other than a Mac.Then in July 2016 I had another idea.. what if I made a Raspberry Pi based handheld? Then I could write my Unsnoopable app in Perl, my preferred programming language!And that's when Noodle Pi was conceived. I worked on a number of prototypes, which used various touchscreen displays, mostly from Adafruit. I ended up destroying many touchscreens in the process of trying to slim down the device as much as possible.In December 2016, I realized I could use Noodle Pi for another of my very old on-hold software projects, which I didn't relish trying to write for iOS, and whose fate I was not OK to leave up to Apple's whims. This was HashCash, a digital cash system I've been working on since the late 90s.Once I realized Noodle Pi would be perfect for HashCash as well, I fired up Emacs, pulled out my dusty old HashCash code, and got to work. The next six months I barely had any time to eat and sleep, between writing HashCash and working on Noodle Pi prototypes.Finally, in June 2017, I released a beta of HashCash and Unsnoopable, and just around that time I received an email announcing the release of the Pimoroni HyperPixel display. A quick look at the specs revealed this would be the perfect screen for Noodle Pi, but by the time I got to Pimoroni's site the display had already sold out! I clicked to be notified when it was back in stock, and I was, but it sold out again within a few hours, and I had to wait for it to come back into stock a second time before I could get hold of a few of them.A few days later the displays finally arrived, and after another multi-week storm of redesigning and prototyping (I was literally designing prototypes in my dreams while sleeping!) I held a fully functional, awesome Noodle Pi in my hand!As you can too. Order yours now!

story:
Short Summary

  • I have a AAS in Civil Engineering Technology and have spent 20+ years in the construction industry.
  • I want to modernize Handyman Services to bring energy efficient and new technologies to homes in the Ohio region.
  • Contributions to my business will help me test new products, market those products, hire employees to install and trouble shoot those products.


What We Need & What You Get

  • I am asking for $50,000 to open an office where these products can be tested and displayed for future clients. 
  • Today's youth is more engaged in technology more than ever. They will be our future in guiding this new technology for future generations.
  • If all the funding is not acquired I will still pursue installing these products in every home in my territory which is Stark County, Ohio
  • REFFERAL CONTEST!!

*Stark County Ohio Area Only*

     

    Risks & Challenges

    People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

    • One of the Risk is that people are scared about the technology tracking your personal information. We all need to work with companies such as Google to make sure all information is kept private. 


      Other Ways You Can Help

      Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

      • Even if you cannot donate you still have the ability to share my goal and get the message passed!
      • Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

Short Summary 
I have a AAS in Civil Engineering Technology and have spent 20+ years in the construction industry. I want to modernize Handyman Services to bring energy efficient and new technologies to homes in the Ohio region. Contributions to my business will help me test new products, market those products, hire employees to install and trouble shoot those products. 
   What We Need & What You Get 
I am asking for $50,000 to open an office where these products can be tested and displayed for future clients.  Today's youth is more engaged in technology more than ever. They will be our future in guiding this new technology for future generations. If all the funding is not acquired I will still pursue installing these products in every home in my territory which is Stark County, Ohio
REFFERAL CONTEST!!
*Stark County Ohio Area Only*
   
  Risks & Challenges  People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal. 
One of the Risk is that people are scared about the technology tracking your personal information. We all need to work with companies such as Google to make sure all information is kept private. 
 
  Other Ways You Can Help Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help: 
Even if you cannot donate you still have the ability to share my goal and get the message passed! Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
About company:

One day there was a boy. He came up with a vision to change the world. That vision was so strong, real and influential that he could not sleep or eat until he came up with an idea. It was the idea. The idea how to empower creative people to shape space in the matter of time. And the journey began. He traveled through the world looking for the soulmates who could help him to make the idea alive. But it was not so easy. The search took ages. The moment he stopped looking for soulmates and started building the idea on his own, the soulmates - comrades in arms found him. And they helped him to build a machine which could build anything. Which could  create an idea into a substance in seconds.  That was it, that was the Phantom 3D printer. But there was still some work left to do. To show the magic box to the world, the boy needed one more helping hand, he needed  the Backers. People who believed in the idea so much that they assisted him by spreading the news about this invention and helping him financially. Probably, without these great people Phantom 3D printer would have never seen the daylight. Be special! Be innovative! Be creative!  Be our supporter!

Phantom is a 3D printer, using plastic as its building material, with two individually working extruders . It allows to print in 35 cm X 35 cm X 35 cm (13.8 inch X 13.8 inch X 13.8 inch) printing space. Due to large space and two individual extruders, 3D Phantom printer is capable of printing two separate objects simultaneously 15 cm X 35 cm X 35 cm (5.9 inch X 13.8 inch X 13.8 inch ) or one large part.  That affects efficiency, as well. This printer prints 1.5-2 times faster compared to any other 3D printer in the market. Whole printers size is 70 cm X 65 cm X 65 cm (27.6 inch X 25.6 inch X 25.6 inch). What is more, cooled printing camera helps by increasing extruders performance and maximizing printing quality. Phantom 3D printer has easily changeable plastic cartridges which will be available on our e-store, which will make it more user friendly. We made easily changeable cartridges, because that is one of the main concerns in the whole printing process. We installed indicators that will show when plastic brakes or cartridges needs to be replaced. These functions makes Phantom 3D printers unique upon other 3D printers.

Printers design:

Currently, available in white corpus design. Later, variety will be expanded with wider colour choice - black, yellow and red.

Next model is Phantom Mini. It will be available in late 2016 and it will have 20 cm X 20 cm X 20 cm (7.9 inch X 7.9 inch X 7.9 inch) printing field.  Whole printer size will be 45 cm X  40 cm X 40 cm (17.7 inch X 15.7 inch X 15.7 inch).

For 3D modeling we provide software - Sketchup. It is easy to use and it provides many online tutorials in many different languages. Phantom plugin will reduce all problems that people had with 3D printing before. We simplified interface of 3D printer to make it more similar to ordinary paper printer. 

Here are few pictures from the creation of Phantom 3D printer:

First prototype:

Case delivery:


What We Need & What You Get

  • We have been working very hard during the past year, and now, the time has come to introduce this project to the society. The biggest problem about plastic 3D printers, discouraging consumers to step into the world of 3D printing. People think that they are very slow. On the other hand, trying to increase the speed always ends up in a huge negative influence in quality. The era of slow, hard to use 3D printers is over! Here comes our solution. Phantom 3D printer will be the only 3D printer which will have 2 individually working extruders, which if necessary, will allow to print one part together or two parts separately. In this way, we increased speed by two times without negative effects on quality. Also we have developed plugin for Sketchup program which simplifies 3D print. It makes to use 3D printer easy like using ordinary paper printer.
  • Our goal was to create a fast 3D printer that even our grandmothers could use. We are almost there! That is why we need your help to set a mass production going.
  • We are planning to reach 200 000 Euros (268 612 USD). This will help us to get started, by starting mass manufacture, setting an office and bringing all team together. 
  • We honestly hope you will like our results reached by our efforts. Because happy customers with our product gives unlimited space for creativeness.

In case we will not achieve our financial goal, we still will be moving forward just slower and anyway will receive their perks no matter what.

These are our perks:


Other Ways You Can Help:

If you can not back up us financially please spread news about us. We would be highly appreciated because your trust and help is what matters the most. Please use great Indiegogo sharing tools and let everybody know that worlds fastest 3D printer is here.

Thanks!!

story:
http://www.cnet.com/products/lark-wi-blueguard/

Meet Blueguard

Blueguard is a safe and simple smart device（lock and video doorbell）. You can set two ways with our APP to enter your house. The first way is touch to open, keep your smart phone or Bluetooth fob in your pocket or directly input a code, then just touch the unlock button to open in convenience. The second way is auto unlock: keep your smart phone or Bluetooth fob in your pocket, Blueguard unlocks hand-free as you are close to your door. You can check your door is locked or unlocked by smartphone or computer no matter where you are.

Blueguard features color video camera, high-sensitivity microphone, speaker and motion sensor. As a Wi-Fi wireless doorbell, when someone presses your doorbell or is approaching to your door, you can answer the call or ignore it. If you choose to answer, Blueguard allows you to see, hear and dialogue with visitors at your door by an IOS or Android smart phone or computer from anywhere in the world. As a home security system, when you're away or the kids are home alone, you can use our APP to set the "alert" mode. In the "alert" mode, the sensor and the camera will detect and record who is at your home door, and take photos or video clips, then send alerts and those photos, video clips to your smartphone or computer .

Blueguard is the new and better way to keep your home safe, convenience and secure.

Blueguard Standard Package includes all you need:

                           Blueguard Standard Package 

Features

Superior Security

All sensor data and video transmission are secure with 2048 bit RSA encryption, the standard protocol for most bank-level data transmission, so that your data will be safely guarded.

See and Dialogue

Two way communications let you see and Dialogue to visitor at your door by an IOS or Android smart phone or computer

Secure

You can check and view photos when anyone enters or leaves your home by your smartphone.

Log Records

You can see a Log Records of who and what time to enter, exit and close to your home from your smartphone.

Bluetooth Fobs

No smartphone? No problem, MU601 Bluetooth fob can lock and unlock your door.

Auto unlock

Blueguard unlocks hand-free as you are close to your door.

Touch unlock

Keep your smart phone or Bluetooth fob in your pocket or directly input a code, Touch to unlock.

Motion Sensor

If a visitor is close to your door sends alert to smartphone.

Turns on the SU202 Smart bulb to welcome you come home at night.

Night Vision

If the motion Sensor detects visitor at night, Blueguard automatically turns on the SU202 Smart bulb. It works like a night vision camera.

Batteries Low Reminder

When the batteries are low, Blueguard will send you a reminder.

"alert" mode and“Silent” Mode

Set your Blueguard as a home door monitor or close the doorbell chime with app.

Key Control

Simply manage Electronic Keys and issues Electronic Keys to family, friends or services in seconds.

Invite a guest to have access your home for any times with app.

How It Works

Blueguard features a Bluetooth Smart Ready 4.1 hub that always on and ready to connect to your smartphone, MU601 Bluetooth fobs, SU202 Bluetooth smart bulbs. Once your Smart phone and MU601 Bluetooth fobs in the Bluetooth RF range, Blueguard will start working to unlock your door or turns on SU202 Bluetooth smart bulbs at night.

Blueguard also features an IEEE802-11 b/g/n device that works with the 2.4ghz band and connects to your home Wi-Fi networks then connects to full-time, fast-speed internet.

If your home has multiple Blueguards, they will automatically be connected together through Wi-Fi.

Using your free Lark-Wi account and free Lark-Wi cloud services, you can easily control your Blueguard Smart Lock and video doorbell anywhere with an Internet connection. 

Specifications

Blueguard:

                                 BLUEGUARD Deadbolt

                                        BLUEGUARD Interior

BLUEGUARD Keypad:

Size

•  Height: 158 mm

•  Width:  75 mm

•  Depth:  9 mm

BLUEGUARD Interior:

Size

•  Height: 184 mm

•  Width:  68 mm

•  Depth:  28mm

BLUEGUARD Deadbolt:

Size

Standard cylinder Deadbolt

Battery Options:

(4) AA Standard alkaline Batteries for smart lock and doorbell normal use (8-10 accesses per day) should operate for a year.

(4) AA Standard energizer ultimate lithium Batteries for smart lock and video doorbell normal use should operate for a year.

Lark-Wi BC10 Li-Ion rechargeable Battery Package 5,400 MA/h for smart lock and video doorbell normal use should operate for a year. (Lark-Wi BC10 Li-Ion rechargeable Battery Package includes built-in battery charging circuit and the USB Port. You can take out this battery Package; charge it by any Standard iPhone or Android USB charger and USB Cable)

 

System requirements

•  home Wi-Fi connection

•  Smartphone or tablet with IOS 5 or later, or Android 4.3+ or later

•  Free Lark-Wi Account

Lark-Wi Blueguard Accessories:

  SU202  Wireless Control 45W Equivalent E26/E27 smart LED light bulb.

   Connectivity: Bluetooth 4 

        SU202 Smart LED light bulb

    MU601 Bluetooth Fob

MU601  double key Bluetooth fob

100 Ft Bluetooth range

Battery door

red LED Light

Size: 50x33x10 mm

Battery Life: 1 year replaceable

Battery Type: CR2032 coin cell

 Connectivity: Bluetooth 4

Designed in  USA

Blueguard was designed in  USA, Cutting Edge, and High Quality. We designed this advanced gadget with new Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, video technologies, making you home smarter and more secure.

Why Blueguard

We believe Blueguard will protect your family, make your home more convenient.

Simple and easy to use:

Blueguard is ready to use right out of the box, there’s no need to wire or connect. It uses standard batteries and easy install, requiring only a screwdriver.

High-value, low price, no monthly fee:

Now Smart lock and Wi-Fi video doorbell in marketing are very expensive, you have to pay monthly fee.

Blueguard no monthly fee, Free International Shipping and save a lot on future retail price.

High quality products and good user experience:

Our joint venture factory has SMT equipment and a large-scale electronic product assembly line and more than 10 years experience in manufacturing electronic products and quality-control. We have the software and hardware design engineers. We believe our products will be well-made, easy to use and provide you with a real benefit.

Development stage

We have currently completed:

 Hardware design

Product tooling 3D design

 Software and APP design

We will soon begin the process of:

Pilot production

Packaging design

Production tooling

Cloud service web and software development

Improving the user experience

Product certifications including CE and FCC certification

Why we need your support

Your support is critical to our long term success. We need your help to scale this Product and bring it to market at an accessible price point.

We will be taking the funds from Indiegogo to move directly into improving product design and purchasing necessary materials and the manufacturing of these products you booked.

Lark-Wi Team

 Press

Please email to  info@lark-wi.com  for more information.

Risks and challenges

While any new endeavor involves risk, The Lark-Wi team has already completed Hardware design, Product tooling 3D design, Software and APP design.

In the team’s experience, there are several points in the design, manufacturing and certification processes that could cause delays. We will keep you informed and ensure you know right away if we have run into challenges.

Certification, software and hardware design all have the biggest potential to affect timing. There is always the possibility of supplier delays. Whatever happens along our production timeline, you can rest assured that we will keep you updated on our progress.
