story:
X STAND

Creating a healthier work environment

 

Not Like Any Other Laptop or Tablet Stand

Crouching towards your device causes fatigue and, often, serious eye strain. The new all-in-one X-STAND creates a more comfortable working environment, eliminating additional fatigue and eyestrain, while at the same time boosting energy and concentration levels.

Studies show sitting at work for extended periods of time can lead to severe health issues and decline in overall productivity. Standing, for just thirty minutes each day, is proven to combat these health concerns, boost energy levels and improve concentration during and after the workday. 
 

X STAND in Standing Mode with Smartphone
Desks with both high and low positions or an adjustable high/low desk are expensive and often non-portable solutions to these problems. The X-STAND provides a very cost-effective solution that can be used anywhere.
 

 

X STAND in Typing Mode with smartphone
 

X STAND in Sitting Mode, keyboard and smartphone

 

Height Adjustable

For maximum comfort and productivity, the X-STAND adjusts to match your body environment at your workstation. The X-STAND allows rapid infinite height adjustment for your screen height to match your eye level.

More Screen Height and Better Slant for Typing

 

In addition to elevating your computer or tablet to a more comfortable viewing height, the X-STAND positions your computer or tablet to a very comfortable 15 degree or 30 degree typing angle utilizing two 3.5" cushioned rods. Your fingers will fly across your keyboard while marking the final details of an article, finishing emails or getting started on a new project on your iPad Pro or laptop.

 

Portable

 

The rods and tube are stored in a Rip-Stop nylon protective case that also has enough room to store your cables, power adapters and much more.

 

Ventilation

Cool down your laptop and protect it from overheating. Where there's electrical power, there's heat. Heat slows down your laptop performance. Because the X-STAND allows you to adjust your laptop's height, in addition to giving you proper posture and eye alignment, it keeps your laptop elevated off the desk allowing air to flow all around the laptop providing better ventilation.

Super Strong and Stable

 

Because of its "X" design, it has a very large footprint allowing it to support large laptops and tablets whether in the standing or keyboard mode. It's "X" design assures there's no flexing while typing or holding your hands on the pad of your laptop. With its high tensile strength fiberglass rods and the aircraft grade aluminum tube, it can easily support three concrete blocks! (150+ lbs)

 

Benefits:

  • Multi-functional - Easily switch from sitting, standing or typing mode - plus holds your smartphone in multiple positions
  • Improves air flow of MacBook and laptop computers
  • Infinite height adjustment for proper viewing angle
  • Affordable - four stands in one
  • Provides healthy ergonomics and proper posture
  • Accommodates, laptops, tablets, smartphones in either portrait or landscape mode with or without cases
  • Magnetically holds smartphone - allows your smartphone to rotate, tilt or swivel to the viewing angle that best suits your needs
  • Super portable and light (weighs less than 1 lb./453.52 grams)
  • Because of the "X" design, the high tensile strength fiberglass rods have a very large footprint allowing it to support large laptops and tablets in sitting, standing, typing modes
  • Materials - Aircraft grade aluminum and high tensile strength fiberglass rods - will last a lifetime and accommodate any new generation laptop, tablet or smartphone
  • No plastic or wood to warp and break
 

Easy to Adjust


The grips can be rotated so as not to interfere with the screen and position them on the black frame of the tablet as shown below.Because of its "X" design, it has a very large footprint allowing it to support large laptops and tablets whether in the standing or keyboard mode. It's "X" design assures there's no flexing while typing or holding your hands on the pad of your laptop. With its high tensile strength fiberglass rods and the aircraft grade aluminum tube, it can easily support three concrete blocks! (150+ lbs)

 

Grips

    Grips easily adjust in and out to accommodate your laptop or tablet with or without a case.

     

    Cable Management - Tame Your Cables

     

    Cable clutter looks bad even when you have a giant workspace. The X- Stand has specialized cable management bands keeping your cables neat, untangled and secure.

    Specialized Magnet for Smartphone

     

    Specifications:

    • Support Tube: 12" X 1.0" X 1.0" (30.48cm X 2.54 cm X 2.54 cm)
    • Rods: 13.5" (34.9cm) 
    • Weight: 13 oz./396.89 gr. (tube 7 oz./198.44 gr) (rods 6 oz./170.09 gr.)
    • Materials: Anodized aircraft grade aluminum, high tensile strength fiberglass rods, vinyl cushioned ends 
    • Cable Management Bands 
    • Two 3.5" Rods for the typing mode (8.89cm) 
    • Optional: 15 Super Bright White LED Lights with plug in wall power adapter with off/on switch or with Dimmer Touch Switch
     

     

     

    MADE IN THE USA

    We believe in creating products and sourcing parts that are made in the USA. We find US products are far superior in quality than those that are massed produced in most other countries. By making this in California we not only hire people and contribute to the local economy, but also we have control of the building and delivery process.

story:
Do you want to be able to share with the World what you care about each day and have it match what you wear?

I am an enthusiastic father whose passion since I was a little kid has been to create things and products that make people's live more enjoyable and easier

Over the last several years, I have developed many ideas built prototypes, but didn't have enough capital to bring my fun ideas to the marketplace for people to enjoy.

I enjoy being an American, but have realized that very little can be done without the generosity of others and the help of the community.  Please help me to fulfill my dream of being an "New product" guy.  My email is wakeboardnski@yahoo.com

What We Need & What You Get

For my first project I am raising just over $540 (already raised $215!).

 I've already built the first version of the prototype and looking to add key electronic components to complete the functionality.

The Impact

I have always enjoyed helping people, I believe that is why I worked my way to be an Eagle Scout, went to school for engineering and continue to work in the Colorado family restaurant industry because I enjoy being able to make a positive impact in people's lives, no matter how minute it may seem!  I do my best to go above and beyond in everything I do or with the people I meet along the way!  

I believe that this product will not only provide people with safety at night, but also allow people to express who they support depending on the day...once I have the patent-pending status...I will go into more detail.

Other Ways You Can Help Me

Getting funding for new ideas is extremely difficult these days, especially for tangebile items unless you happen to know someone, if you do happen to know someone, I would love an introduction.

story:
OrthoGraph on Android - we should do it together

Have you ever tried to create a floor plan of an existing room or building? If yes, then you know it's a hard work. The first sketch of your floor plan doesn't look like the numbers tell you, measurement errors are realized only later at home or in your office, and that is also typical that you forget to measure something, that would be really necessary to have to plan your move, renovation; create your CAD drawing or to do the energy audit of a building.

If you are a carpenter, then you know how important it is to have an exact drawing, as all angles and distances strongly count to succeed with your job.

As a painter how easy it were to have painting surface calculations with just a tap, even on site? You could give your proposal direct there, at the same moment you have finished with your measurements.

All this is there in OrthoGraph Architect today, but only on iPad.

With this campaign we want to make it available for Android users too!

OrthoGraph Architect is available on the iPad for more than 2 years, and we have requests continuously from the beginning to make it available on droid too. We have even made a poll on our Facebook page, and the result was the same, so we decided to fulfill this demand.

The 4 most important unique features besides the many others that OrthoGraph has are the following:

  1. Intuitive way of drawing rooms like you were with pencil and paper
  2. Through measures the room shape gets exact and alive instantly
  3. The results can be exported to many CAD formats or watched live in 3D
  4. Surface calculations are there for you, all right on the spot

Watch the video how it works on iPad today, and maybe on Android tomorrow:

See OrthoGraph Architect's 1st steps guide on Prezi for details about how it works!

Android and other platforms

We spent a lot of time to find out the best way of developing OrthoGraph Architect Android version. In the past half year we have made some researches, small trial projects and we clarified out the right way of creating the Android version. It is also clear for us that if we set near deadlines - that’s what our customers would expect from us - then we will need external help and resources from Android professionals. Without this boost we need 1-1.5 years to do the development with our internal resources.

Meanwhile, in addition to the above investigation we got many requests from you to use OrthoGraph on further platforms like Windows 8 (e.g. running OrthoGraph on Windows Surface or any tablet/notebook) too.

After lots of internal and external discussions it became clear for us, that we can do it, and will need a common environment to develop and run OrthoGraph on Android and on iOS platforms too.

If we get enough support from you, then we will be able to create also the Windows 8 touchscreen version of OrthoGraph.

This is a large work, so for this we need your support!

The development

The new version will not be a simple replacement of the current OrthoGraph Architect product, but it will hold many new features in addition to the current functionality. Such will be a stronger, more professional 3D rendering engine (including lights, shadows), 3D editing (maybe not in the first release), multi-texture materials on objects and walls (you can e.g. color the wall meanwhile you choose tiles on that), and we plan to build in a customizable object library. Latter will not only be filled up with objects made by us, but we will look also for partners to help in that, and we would like to open it up to our users too, so that you can create your own 3D objects with most popular 3D graphics software that can save to our chosen standard format. This format will be selected to be supported widely by popular 3D graphics software.

We have started developing OrthoGraph from scratch - meanwhile proceeding with the development of the current product -, and when it is ready, then we will replace the current product with the new one. This new version will be released on the following platforms: iOS (iPad), Android tablets and if we get enough support from you, then as a stretch goal also on Windows 8 (with touchscreen support).

This will not happen for the first time that we develop OrthoGraph from scratch. We have done it once for Windows Mobile, and as you can see, we have done it again 3 years ago for the iPad version. We have reached a certain level of the software, that we won't let decrease. The funding we get goes simply to one direction, we hire an experienced development team for helping in the programming of the new version.

This project is huge and long, we will need roughly 8 Months for this development. The more support from you we get, the more people we can hire for the project, so it might take less time depending on the success of this campaign.

The first 1.5 Month will be the planning and prototyping. In this phase we will do those parts of the development that will let us adding all the features later, in jargon we can say that we will create the engine, the strong substructure of the system.

In the next phase we will create an Alpha version in two phases, before Christmas we will present you a reduced functionality stable version - only on focusing on the most important core features -, and later we will create a full functionality Alpha version. This will end in March. One month later we will have a fully functional Beta version for final compatibility testing.

Beta testing will need time. In this phase we will try not to change any of the features implemented, but make them stable, fast and reliable. We plan to finish with the product at the end of May.

What will you get with backing us?

First of all you will get OrthoGraph Architect on your Android faster, or if you don not have Android, but you have iPad, you will get your OrthoGraph Architect on your iPad with better performance, strongly enhanced rendering and bright new features. The question is not if you get it (sure you will), but the speed of development. The sooner we get support from you and the more we get, the earlier we will finish!

Secondly, you get the perk you have chosen, which can be a license, a feature, some or a combination of above - on strongly discounted price compared to the released version. We have different licenses (subscription or never expiring full functionality), and all for different platforms. Having a subscription means you are entitled to use the full functionality of OrthoGraph Architect for a given period of time meanwhile you can use OrthoGraph Cloud features, like storing your data on our hosted servers with versioning (Cloud Pro subscription) and use the teamwork and file versioning features simply on all files stored by us (Cloud Business subscription). The full licenses are also on a reduced price, but it is even unsure yet whether there will be time unlimited license outside of this campaign. If there will be, then we will sell it over $200 in the future, but we will focus on subscription based licenses. Please pick your choice or choices now.

Thirdly, we also have beta tester and consultation seats, so you can make your impact on the final product. You can feel yourself as part of the team, somebody, who helped a dream come true.

Last but not least we also have stretch goals.

We will create the Android version of OrthoGraph Architect in approximately 1 year, the question is the speed, and whether it will be available on other platforms too, as quality and minimum features are not negotiable.

If we reach the 25K limit, then of course you all get the perk chosen, and we will make the development in 8 Months. We will update you with videos, and the ones who purchased that perk also get the beta versions starting from very early phases to contribute as beta testers.

If we stretch to 50K, then we will create the Windows 8 version focusing on Microsoft Surface Pro, and its touch screen functionality.

Other Ways You Can Help Us

OrthoGraph Architect Android version will be developed independently whether this campaign succeeds or not, we already started the development. The time frame and the destination platforms are the only question. Our development record can ensure you that we are able and dedicated to do the job, our only limitation is the resources we have. If you need OrthoGraph Architect on Android or other new platforms, or you just want the new features this development enables, then support this campaign. 

If you cannot do it, or you find OrthoGraph Architect a great idea but you don't need the product, then please spread the word, share it, tweet it, blog it. The more people know about us, the closest we are to our common goal: 

OrthoGraph Architect on Android - let's make it together!

FAQ

1. Will I get my perk if the campaign doesn't reach its goal?

Sure you will! We need the campaign only to accelerate the development, and by the stretch goals to step forward to other platforms too. Don't forget: these perks contain a large discount too, so get them as soon as you can!

2. I already have an iPad version. Will I get the new version on my iPad?

Sure you will! We love our users and we would like to honor them with the new version as soon as possible!

3. The version I purchase will run on all platforms?

No, The iPad version will run on iPad, the Android version will run on Android and that's true for all versions that we will be able to create.

4. How can I participate in the beta testing program?

First of all buy your perk as soon as you can. Then drop us a comment or e-mail that you would be interested to join the beta testing program, and we will contact you soon with all details.

This is the progress for today:

story:
Hi I’m Bill, I work with Zack at BOING! Designs. We wanted to create a flexible stand to hold any smartphone, and wanted it to be fun. We brainstormed many ideas: bears, flamingos, wombats, but honestly, what is more fun than a monkey?

Phone Monkey... that Phunky Monkey™!

 

Project Summary

The Phone Monkey™ is a flexible Smartphone stand made from high quality silicone and steel. Phone Monkey frees up your hands and holds any Smartphone from the iPhone running iOS, to the Galaxy Note running Android, to the Nokia Lumia running Windows, and everything in between in a viewing position on any flat surface or hanging from a rear-view mirror, door knob or even just a nail. Use the Phone Monkey as a tripod or as a stand for Skype or FaceTime. We have created ABS prototypes to confirm dimensions and have received factory samples to confirm materials and function. Phone Monkey is ready to go to mold and begin production. 

Now we need your help... we've created a great product and need some additional resources to make it a reality. Check out the great Backer Rewards on the right and help us reach our goal of a Phone Monkey (or a whole barrel of Phone Monkeys) in every home. 

No Batteries Required! But please 1 Banana a day. 

 

This is a follow up project to a successfully funded Kickstarter campaign of the same name.

It works with every smartphone:

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Sure it can hold just about anything, but where will I put it? 

Tripod!   Skype!   FaceTime!

When we started playing with it we discovered it was a lot more than just a stand for a desk. The bendable tail can act as a hook to hold the monkey anywhere: a doorknob, from your rear view mirror, or even just a nail in a board. Every day we think of new ways to use the Phone Monkey.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Where will you use your monkey? 

Office, kitchen, outside, car, bath...

How was the Phone Monkey born?

My 5 year old son was playing with an old Gumby character and my phone and said “Look Daddy, Gumby is hugging your phone!”

 

 

Then Zack Brown (Lead Product Designer) and I started talking about creating a Gumby type character to hold a Smartphone. (Yes, Zack Stretcherz was named after Zack Brown!) That was the first a-ha moment, ‘We could make a fun, flexible way to hold a Smartphone on a desk.” We decided to create an animal shape. 

A couple of days later came some more unexpected inspiration: a friend complained that he almost got in an accident trying to use the GPS function on his phone and asked if I had a way to mount it in his car.

 

We started experimenting and put model "Phone Gumby" to the test. We took him for a rest drive in the car in several locations, on the dash, in cup holders, in the ash tray. Then I hit my head on the rear-view mirror… What if I hang it from the mirror? How can we hang it, an arm, a leg, or a tail? - ooooo a long flexible tail! Now what kind of animal would hang from a mirror with a long flexible tail? A MONKEY! Really, what other choice is there? 

Then we started designing the Phone Monkey. Zack (Brown, not Stretcherz) is very talented in CAD. We skipped the napkin stage went directly to CAD drawings. (Zack prefers Rhino for his CAD software)

 

On the first try Zack came up with something that we thought would work. With the preliminary designs in hand, it was time to create a 3D model to test the design. BOING Designs has a Dimension 768 SST 3D printer. It prints by laying down ABS in layers upon layers to build up a 3D part. It squirts slightly melted ABS out of a nozzle in much the same manner as a cake decorator squeezes frosting out of a tube. As soon as the string of ABS touches the existing material it sticks and cools. Acetone or ABS solvent can be used to smooth the surface and create a better bond between layers.

 

 

The first test is to check the over all geometry and the size of the Phone Monkey. 

 

 

ABS isn't flexible, so to simulate a flexible tail we taped on a thick wire. 

 

 

We learned several things from the printed prototype:

·  The upper body and arms are great. We don’t need any major changes.

·  The legs should be longer to allow for a wider variety of phones. To keep the same overall size we need to decrease the length of the lower torso.

·  Adding a heel would allow for a more stable stance when the Phone Monkey is holding a phone on a flat surface.

·  The tail can be mounted to the hip to remove the bump on the back. (Purely aesthetic)

·  The tail needs to be much longer. The current short tail would not be able to hold onto thicker rear-mirrors mounts in many of today’s cars. It also adds additional flexibility (pun unintended) for mounting to a wider variety of objects. 

Zack quickly made the changes and we printed a new version of the Phone Monkey.

 

 

We tested the tail using another wire. 

 

 

 

Here’s a side by side comparison of the Phone Monkey two prototypes.

 

 

All the changes worked exactly as intended. The longer tail provided enough reach to wrap around thicker rear-view mirrors. The longer legs will allow mounting to a wider variety of phones and it looks better too!

It was time to send the files to the factory. We specified high quality silicone over-molded on a steel skeleton. To ensure durability, the tail would be welded to the skeleton. 

To our amazement, the very first samples came back perfect. Anyone who has experience developing products knows that this is a rare occasion. They were so perfect that I used the first samples for the images of this Kickstarter project. We are ready to give the go ahead to finalize the mold and get ready for production. We just need your help, please check out the rewards to the right.

 

How will we manufacture and deliver the Phone Monkey?

Several years ago I was fortunate enough to meet Jay Hanson. He has over 25 years of experience manufacturing overseas. Jay has factory contacts for just about every type of material you can imagine. If he doesn't have the capability for a certain project, he’ll find the right factory to produce it. He helped BOING! Designs manufacture our products.www.boingdesigns.com Over the years, Jay and I have created a friendship from a working relationship. We have recently begun to help inventors and companies who need manufacturing assistance bring their ideas to market. (We can help you too! See the bottom reward at the right if you need manufacturing assistance.)

Jay recently returned from a trip to China where he visited several factories including the factory which will produce the Phone Monkey. The factory can produce hundreds of thousands of Phone Monkeys; capacity is not an issue.

BOING! Designs has already contacted several companies for help in distributing the Phone Monkey Kickstarter project. We have settled on two companies, one for international and one for domestic:

For domestic backers we plan to utilize a Beaverton, Oregon based company PrintSync, who has the capability to quickly fulfill mass mailings to the entire country. Last year they processed a friend’s Kickstarter project with over 4000 pieces sent to 2500 unique USA addresses in less than 48 hours. www.printsync.com

For international backers we have experience with DirectLink. They are owned by the Swedish postal service. I've received good feedback from others who have used DirectLink for their Kickstarter projects. The options offered for creating labels by DirectLink is much more efficient than is offered by the USPS. If you've ever tried to do a bulk international shipment with the USPS, you know what I’m saying. Here’s an article about DirectLink. http://www.ecommercebytes.com/cab/abu/y213/m05/abu0334/s02

Both PrintSync and DirectLink can take the spreadsheet created by Kickstarter with backer addresses and automatically create shipping labels.

We feel like we have addressed all issues with manufacturing and distribution, but something can always surprise us. 

Patent Pending.

 

Other Perks

 

$35 - 1 Phone Monkey and 1 Phone Monkey branded Stylus pen

 

 

$38 - 1 Phone Monkey and 1 Phone Monkey T-Shirt

Get Mohit's version of the Phone Monkey T-Shirt. I'm not sure how the double sided print will work, but I'm sure we'll figure something out. 

 

 

$40 - 1 Phone Monkey and 1 Phone Monkey laser engraved Helios magnetic levitating pen

 

 

Press Coverage
story_txt:
Hi I’m Bill, I work with Zack at BOING! Designs. We wanted to create a flexible stand to hold any smartphone, and wanted it to be fun. We brainstormed many ideas: bears, flamingos, wombats, but honestly, what is more fun than a monkey?
Phone Monkey... that Phunky Monkey™!
 
Project Summary
The Phone Monkey™ is a flexible Smartphone stand made from high quality silicone and steel. Phone Monkey frees up your hands and holds any Smartphone from the iPhone running iOS, to the Galaxy Note running Android, to the Nokia Lumia running Windows, and everything in between in a viewing position on any flat surface or hanging from a rear-view mirror, door knob or even just a nail. Use the Phone Monkey as a tripod or as a stand for Skype or FaceTime. We have created ABS prototypes to confirm dimensions and have received factory samples to confirm materials and function. Phone Monkey is ready to go to mold and begin production. 
Now we need your help... we've created a great product and need some additional resources to make it a reality. Check out the great Backer Rewards on the right and help us reach our goal of a Phone Monkey (or a whole barrel of Phone Monkeys) in every home. 
No Batteries Required! But please 1 Banana a day. 
 
This is a follow up project to a successfully funded Kickstarter campaign of the same name.
It works with every smartphone:
 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Sure it can hold just about anything, but where will I put it? 
Tripod!   Skype!   FaceTime!
When we started playing with it we discovered it was a lot more than just a stand for a desk. The bendable tail can act as a hook to hold the monkey anywhere: a doorknob, from your rear view mirror, or even just a nail in a board. Every day we think of new ways to use the Phone Monkey.

Office, kitchen, outside, car, bath...

story:
Learn how to make iOS 8 iPhone and iPad apps with Swift. No programming experience required. All you need is a mac.

I am making the course that I wish I had when I was trying to learn iOS development. I feel like I have a unique perspective to teach this class because I've been the n00b that can't understand the tutorials or blog posts.

What will be covered in the class?

I will walk you through everything you need to start making apps. Getting Xcode (the program we use to make apps) setup and on your machine, making a developer account with Apple, and running the iPhone and iPad simulator on your mac.

I firmly believe that the best way to learn is by doing. This class will focus on making apps. We will make a series of apps that teach you different skills. Here is an overview of the apps we'll be making.

An app that...

  • ...connects with Facebook and Twitter
  • ...uses the front and rear cameras on iOS devices
  • ...records audio with the microphone
  • ...uses GPS information
  • ...connects with PARSE to make a social network

Once each of these apps are built, I will tell you everything you need to know to submit these apps to the App Store. This could be a whole class in and of itself!


  •  In-App Purchases. Make money from the apps you are going to make!
  •  Flappy Bird Clone. Learn how to make games as we walk through making a Flappy Bird clone.
  • Sign in with Twitter and Facebook. This will make your social apps more appealing and easy to use.
  • Bluetooth. Learn how to use Bluetooth in your app so it can talk with bluetooth enabled devices.

What makes you a good teacher?

  • I have 15 apps in the App Store that I built from scratch
  • I have been doing iOS development for 3+ years
  • When I was first learning iOS development, I was often confused by wordy blog posts and tutorials. I will never talk over your head

story:
Short Summary

After completing my MBA at MIT, I ran a computerized analytical trading fund for Kidder Peabody & Co., Inc. I then started and ran a hedge fund (Centurion Capital Group), based on similar techniques. At the same time I founded Delivery.com, which grew to become a major player in the online food ordering space. I sold a majority interest to Cantor Fitzgerald in 2009 and later founded Thankster.com.

Thankster is a platform that facilitates the creation of personalized cards and thank you notes that use simulated, authentic looking handwriting. Our technology varies each instance of the characters in the card message, producing a natural flow and look. We also print, stuff, seal, stamp and mail the cards. Thankster sits at the nexus of new web technology and old world etiquette. This indiegogo funding will help us create a mobile app, allowing users to spread civility and kindness while on the go. 

 

What We Need & What You Get


We are seeking $17,500 to complete Thankster's web app.  If enough is raised, we would also flesh out our API to make our functionality available to companies, and to create mobile applications (iPhone/iPad, Android) so that users can send thank you notes to friends and family on the go. We've had so much great feedback about the project and the concept, and we really want to make it accessible and easy to use for as many people as possible. Plus, we know a lot of graduations and Weddings are coming soon with Spring and Summer, so we'd love to have everything in place for you to use. See some of our great perks as well.

Our perks include free Thankster projects that you can use to send physical cards to friends and family for any occasion and creating a font out of your handwriting that you can use in programs like Microsoft Word and Adobe Photoshop


The Impact

Though the use of digital messaging is ever increasing, there are some types of correspondence which are best served by a handwritten note or card - for example, wedding or Bar Mitzvah thank yous, thank yous for expressions of sympathy, etc. For businesses, a succinct, handwritten note can really cut through the clutter when managing client relationships. In fact, the impact of handwritten notes will only increase the more we rely on the various methods of digital messaging available today.

By greatly reducing the laborious and repetitive elements of manually writing notes by hand (especially when writing the same or similar text to many recipients), the user can focus on the sentiment and content, and save a lot of time and effort in the process. The resulting cards retain a personal touch, because they appear to be, and directly derive from, characters that are actually handwritten and vary within the document. This also allows certain automation which would otherwise be impractical, especially on the business side.

The mobile apps will be great for cards being sent to fewer recipients.  Imagine that you are out and realize you forgot to send a birthday card to someone important, and you can whip out your mobile device, type a message in your own handwriting, and have it sent in the mail right then and there!

Previously, I have created and run Delivery.com, which is also a website that brings technology to an old process to make it better and easier.


Other Ways You Can Help

Thanks a lot, and whether you contribute financially or not, comments, thoughts, suggestions are all very welcome. Please share it if you like the idea, using the Indiegogo share tools or via any other social and networking tools. We’d really appreciate it!

__________


How does Thankster Work?

Thankster makes producing “handwritten” cards easier by letting the user type in the message, starting with a master template that is instantly replicated for all recipients. The user can then edit that basic message individually for any recipient. Users are able to either select a handwriting style provided, allowing for adjustments in size and spacing, or use their own handwriting by uploading a sample. The customer will know the exact look and feel of their notes and they can be assured they are getting precisely what they want.

Users can scan in a form with a sample of their handwriting, or input it using their iPhone or iPad.


Sample Messages to Get You Started

Thank you notes can often feel so challenging not only because of the magnitude of the task of physically writing them, but also because it can be overwhelming to figure out how to get started. What do I write? What is the etiquette and structure? How do I begin? To help get over that hump, thankster provides many wording samples, plus etiquette tips, that can be used to get started.

story:
Why Atomotion?

We developed a new 3D printer called the Apparatus ARC using a full feedback servo setup with brushless DC motors and inexpensive magnetic encoder sensors. To do this we needed a fast microcontroller with a lot of IO. The options for making a prototype were either not capable of making the whole system, not flexible enough to handle different motor types, or just too expensive to prototype with.

We made a limited prototype using a less expensive development board and then designed our own custom board with more IO available to create our full prototype.

What. A. Pain.

This inspired our design for the Atomotion system. It is the toolbox for building and developing more intelligent automated stuff.

We've finalized the V1 system design, that's it above. There are four different types of boards: Controller, Backplane, Function Module, and Power. You might notice we divided up the Backplane and Power from our last design. This simplifies the Backplanes and will make it more simple and cheaper to use something like an ITX power supply for the input.

We've given enough power and space in the system to do some pretty amazing things. The layout allows for a system that uses up to 60A@35V DC, that's around 2kW of power to motors, laser diodes, lights, heaters, or anything else electronic. To handle that, we've thought through things like cooling and how it might fit inside your creations. 

On one side we have all of the connections to the Function Modules along with USB-A host ports (on the Pro Controller) and the programming micro USB port (mbed compatible) for the main controller.

On the other side we have all of the ports like power and USB-B. The Pro Controller has ethernet and HDMI as well.

The casing is shown for the 8 Module configuration with a Pro Controller and 10A 5.5mm barrel plug. The optional 40mm fans are there for those applications that the Function Modules run hot. 

8 Module System Size (60mm Deep)
4 Module System Size (60mm Deep)

OpenCNX


 
The interface between modules is the peanut butter and jelly in our sandwich of automation technology. We've taken a lot of time thinking through how to give the most flexibility and usable power so that the system will be both easy to use and extremely flexible. Both the 34 pin and 164 pin connections between the different modules are already up on Github. We have even put together a template for the Function Modules so that you can quickly design your own in KiCad. We will continue to release more of the system into open source licensing, either immediately when it is ready to share or we will have bounties for some of the more complex things like the controller modules.
 

What will you build?

•K22 Freescale/NXP ARM Cortex m4 Microcontroller with Floating Point Processor
•Full Size USB-B Connector for Direct Connections
•Micro USB-B Connector for Flashing (Possibly MBED Compatible)
•26 Pin interface to Raspberry Pi
•OpenCNX 164 Connector

•Supports 4X OpenCNX 34 Compatible Modules
•1X OpenCNX 164 Controller
•Power Input up to DC 35V 32A
•Power Conditioning and Voltage Regulation for All Onboard Power Supply

•Supports 8X OpenCNX 34 Compatible Modules
•1X OpenCNX 164 Controller
•Power Input up to DC 35V 64A
•Power Conditioning and Voltage Regulation for All Onboard Power Supply

•Four Toshiba TB67S109AFTG(QFN48) Stepper Driver ICs (3A Drive Current, 1/32 microstepping)
•One K02F Freescale/NXP ARM Cortex m4 Microcontroller for High Frequency Stepping and Motion Control
•Four 3-pin Limit Sensor Connectors
•OpenCNX 34 Dual Compatible

•One Toshiba TB67S109AFTG(QFN48) Stepper Driver ICs (3A Drive Current, 1/32 microstepping)
•One K02F Freescale/NXP ARM Cortex m4 Microcontroller for High Frequency Stepping and Motion Control
•Two 3-pin Limit Sensor Connectors
•One I2C Header
•Two Input Pin Header for AB Quadrature or Other Sensor Feedback
•Supports Servo Control Using Quadrature Sensor (Sensor is separate to the module.) 
•OpenCNX 34 Compatible

•Two 2-Pin High Current MOSFET Drives for Heaters (@ System Input Voltage, Maximum 8A Combined)
•Two 2-Pin Low Current Drives for Fans (12V, 0.5A Each)
•Two Thermistor Connections for Temperature Sensing Up To 280C
•OpenCNX 34 Compatible

•Two 2-Pin High Current MOSFET Drives for Heaters (@ System Input Voltage, Maximum 8A Combined)
•Two 2-Pin Low Current Drives for Fans (12V, 0.5A Each)
•Two Thermistor Connections for Temperature Sensing Up To 280C
•Two Thermocouple (K Type) Connections using 2X MAX31855 IC (up to 1260C)
•OpenCNX 34 Compatible

•General IO module:
   •I2C interface
   •2 PWM Out
   •4 IO Pin
   •2 Analog Pin
   •3.3V plus Ground
   •5V plus Ground
   •12V plus Ground
   •OpenCNX 34 Compatible

•Logic Chip Based Laser Fire Safety (controls a large laser power supply)
   •Combines Chiller Status, 2X Door Switches, and Input from Controller Module
•PWM or Analog Drive for Most External Laser Power Supplies
•Current Controlled Drive for 5V Laser Diode (Max 1A)
•OpenCNX 34 Compatible

What's Next?

To create a production ready design for both the Controller Module and support for Raspberry Pi, we need around $25,000 in pre-orders. If we don't reach the goal, we will complete the Controller Module first and continue development as we have additional sales. Most of the design work is done for the Function Modules that we are showing. We will do a final schematic revision and PCB layout based on the V1.0 of the specifications and from your feedback. The Controller Module is a more simple version of our existing ARC controller, so we expect the final design and layout will go quickly. The tooling for each casing is just a single mold, and will cost us less than $3,000 to produce. We have local connections in China run a limited production run or for a full scale production, so we are good to go in any situation. 

Software is the other part of this, since no microcontroller is useful without it. Our plan is to contribute a Smoothieware porting to that project to make it compatible with our hardware. If the project is successful enough, we will consider developing more advanced software tools to make creating robots or CNC machines much more simple and robust. Things like system kinematic modeling from CAD models or self-configuring systems based on the modules that are loaded. 

Experience

Our team has experience with the full process of product development, manufacturing, and fulfillment. We shipped around 2000 3D printer kits as former founders of MakiBox, we helped Ambi Climate with the production of several hundred beta units for their launch, and we have previously been involved in product development and manufacturing for several consumer product companies for over a decade.

Risks & Challenges

With any product launch there are going to be some unexpected challenges, but we have the experience and partners to do this well. 

Being located in Hong Kong and having been in the consumer product industry for 16 years, the manufacturing part of this project is very manageable. For production we will use a local factory owned and run by Swedish company Note. Arrow is also giving the design a once over to give us feedback on the engineering and also to help with the BOM finalization. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you would like to help, please spread the word:

  • Tell your hackerspace, coworkers, friends, and family about some cool new technology. (OK, we know this is a bit of an over the top technical project for most folks, but at least tell your mom.)
  • Please share using the Indiegogo share tools up at the top of the page.
story_txt:
Why Atomotion?
We developed a new 3D printer called the Apparatus ARC using a full feedback servo setup with brushless DC motors and inexpensive magnetic encoder sensors. To do this we needed a fast microcontroller with a lot of IO. The options for making a prototype were either not capable of making the whole system, not flexible enough to handle different motor types, or just too expensive to prototype with.

We made a limited prototype using a less expensive development board and then designed our own custom board with more IO available to create our full prototype.
What. A. Pain.
This inspired our design for the Atomotion system. It is the toolbox for building and developing more intelligent automated stuff.

We've finalized the V1 system design, that's it above. There are four different types of boards: Controller, Backplane, Function Module, and Power. You might notice we divided up the Backplane and Power from our last design. This simplifies the Backplanes and will make it more simple and cheaper to use something like an ITX power supply for the input.
We've given enough power and space in the system to do some pretty amazing things. The layout allows for a system that uses up to 60A@35V DC, that's around 2kW of power to motors, laser diodes, lights, heaters, or anything else electronic. To handle that, we've thought through things like cooling and how it might fit inside your creations. 

On one side we have all of the connections to the Function Modules along with USB-A host ports (on the Pro Controller) and the programming micro USB port (mbed compatible) for the main controller.

On the other side we have all of the ports like power and USB-B. The Pro Controller has ethernet and HDMI as well.
The casing is shown for the 8 Module configuration with a Pro Controller and 10A 5.5mm barrel plug. The optional 40mm fans are there for those applications that the Function Modules run hot. 
8 Module System Size (60mm Deep)4 Module System Size (60mm Deep)

OpenCNX

 
The interface between modules is the peanut butter and jelly in our sandwich of automation technology. We've taken a lot of time thinking through how to give the most flexibility and usable power so that the system will be both easy to use and extremely flexible. Both the 34 pin and 164 pin connections between the different modules are already up on Github. We have even put together a template for the Function Modules so that you can quickly design your own in KiCad. We will continue to release more of the system into open source licensing, either immediately when it is ready to share or we will have bounties for some of the more complex things like the controller modules. 
What will you build?




•K22 Freescale/NXP ARM Cortex m4 Microcontroller with Floating Point Processor•Full Size USB-B Connector for Direct Connections•Micro USB-B Connector for Flashing (Possibly MBED Compatible)•26 Pin interface to Raspberry Pi•OpenCNX 164 Connector

•Supports 4X OpenCNX 34 Compatible Modules•1X OpenCNX 164 Controller•Power Input up to DC 35V 32A•Power Conditioning and Voltage Regulation for All Onboard Power Supply

•Supports 8X OpenCNX 34 Compatible Modules•1X OpenCNX 164 Controller•Power Input up to DC 35V 64A•Power Conditioning and Voltage Regulation for All Onboard Power Supply

•Four Toshiba TB67S109AFTG(QFN48) Stepper Driver ICs (3A Drive Current, 1/32 microstepping)•One K02F Freescale/NXP ARM Cortex m4 Microcontroller for High Frequency Stepping and Motion Control•Four 3-pin Limit Sensor Connectors•OpenCNX 34 Dual Compatible

•One Toshiba TB67S109AFTG(QFN48) Stepper Driver ICs (3A Drive Current, 1/32 microstepping)•One K02F Freescale/NXP ARM Cortex m4 Microcontroller for High Frequency Stepping and Motion Control•Two 3-pin Limit Sensor Connectors•One I2C Header•Two Input Pin Header for AB Quadrature or Other Sensor Feedback•Supports Servo Control Using Quadrature Sensor (Sensor is separate to the module.) •OpenCNX 34 Compatible

•Two 2-Pin High Current MOSFET Drives for Heaters (@ System Input Voltage, Maximum 8A Combined)•Two 2-Pin Low Current Drives for Fans (12V, 0.5A Each)•Two Thermistor Connections for Temperature Sensing Up To 280C•OpenCNX 34 Compatible

•Two 2-Pin High Current MOSFET Drives for Heaters (@ System Input Voltage, Maximum 8A Combined)•Two 2-Pin Low Current Drives for Fans (12V, 0.5A Each)•Two Thermistor Connections for Temperature Sensing Up To 280C•Two Thermocouple (K Type) Connections using 2X MAX31855 IC (up to 1260C)•OpenCNX 34 Compatible

•General IO module:   •I2C interface   •2 PWM Out   •4 IO Pin   •2 Analog Pin   •3.3V plus Ground   •5V plus Ground   •12V plus Ground   •OpenCNX 34 Compatible

•Logic Chip Based Laser Fire Safety (controls a large laser power supply)   •Combines Chiller Status, 2X Door Switches, and Input from Controller Module•PWM or Analog Drive for Most External Laser Power Supplies•Current Controlled Drive for 5V Laser Diode (Max 1A)•OpenCNX 34 Compatible
What's Next?
To create a production ready design for both the Controller Module and support for Raspberry Pi, we need around $25,000 in pre-orders. If we don't reach the goal, we will complete the Controller Module first and continue development as we have additional sales. Most of the design work is done for the Function Modules that we are showing. We will do a final schematic revision and PCB layout based on the V1.0 of the specifications and from your feedback. The Controller Module is a more simple version of our existing ARC controller, so we expect the final design and layout will go quickly. The tooling for each casing is just a single mold, and will cost us less than $3,000 to produce. We have local connections in China run a limited production run or for a full scale production, so we are good to go in any situation. 
Software is the other part of this, since no microcontroller is useful without it. Our plan is to contribute a Smoothieware porting to that project to make it compatible with our hardware. If the project is successful enough, we will consider developing more advanced software tools to make creating robots or CNC machines much more simple and robust. Things like system kinematic modeling from CAD models or self-configuring systems based on the modules that are loaded. 

Experience

We shipped around 2000 3D printer kits as former founders of MakiBox, we helped Ambi Climate with the production of several hundred beta units for their launch, and we have previously been involved in product development and manufacturing for several consumer product companies for over a decade.

For production we will use a local factory owned and run by Swedish company Note. Arrow is also giving the design a once over to give us feedback on the engineering and also to help with the BOM finalization.

Tell your hackerspace, coworkers, friends, and family about some cool new technology. (OK, we know this is a bit of an over the top technical project for most folks, but at least tell your mom.)

story:
Why pay thousands of bucks on a 3D Printer when you can make one yourself in less than $250. 

Introducing "The Ultimate Guide to 3D printing in less than $250", that teaches you step by step on how to make a 3D printer that has superb quality and affordability.

We aim to make 3D printing more popular, like it was done in the case of older technologies of 2D printers. Our ebook is for everyone.


What We Need & What You Get

We are students. When we made our own 3d printer we faced many difficulties due to high cost of materials and lack of complete information about the method to be adopted to make a 3d printer.

So we developed an e-book giving step by step information on how to make a 3d printer at a very low cost.

"The Ultimate Guide to Make your own 3D Printer in Less than $250" provides step by step by step instuctions from scratch and detailed information on making your own 3D Printer.
 


Target Audience


With the best cost-efficiency of our printer, we believe that our guide is most suitable for families, students and educational institutions.

Regardless of that anyone can make use of our 3D printing guide.

For Makers who want explore the world of 3D Printing.
For Designers to show their creativity to the world.
For Architects and Engineers to make prototypes.
And anyone else who has a passion for this.

Contents of the book

1. Introduction to 3D Printing and its Application
2. Bill of Materials and where to buy them cheap
3. Mechanical Assembly of parts
4. Wiring and Connections
5. Computer Setup and Hardware Integration
6. Software Installation
7. Commissioning and calibration
8. Maintenance and Safety
9. Get Set and 3D Print!

How Money raised is spent?

We aim to raise $500 for materials to refine and package our technology into a producible product.   In order to achieve the reliability and price point needed to make this good invention a great product, we need to finish our research and development.

If we reach our goal:

1. $250 To make a 3D Printer.
2. $50 For developing customised electronic circuits. 
3. $50 Refine our high-pressure extruder design. To make the it fastest and precise.
4. $70 for shipping of software DVDs with the ebook to our backers.
5.  $80 Indiegogo fees + Paypal fees + Currency conversion rate.

Funds will go toward the following activities:  

  1. Refine our high-pressure extruder design.  We currently have a reliable extrusion trace at around 30 microns but believe this can be reduced to 20 microns (the best in the world).
  2. Add a second print head for multi-colour print or multi-material print.
  3. Optimize the integrated motor carriage design.
  4. Refine custom firmware for the printer to optimize printing using metal.  
  5. Create the OpenSource software environment in order to foster a good user experience, particularly for the non-technical craftsperson.
  6. Work with industrial partners to tool up for production of the machine with injection molding.  (To reduce the costs.)


    Even small kids can use our guide. It's that easy!




What can you do with your 3D Printer? 


Developing artificial limbs for handicapped people.


Biologists are working on artificial organs printed by a 3D printer.


Fashion designers have developed amazing accessories with a 3D Printer. 




Oh yes, 3d printed chocolates!



And ofcourse an another 3D-Printer. ;-)

story:
p BAG

Store your Card secure with p BAG and RFID fraud protectection. The first cell phone case with NanoSuction. You can use it more then once. Get Yours!

Stick the p BAG on every smooth flat surface and store credit cards, money, tickets, mp3 Player, spoons, toothpicks, toothbrushes, candys...

 

... let spread out your immagination!

 

 

 

Today’s cards make it super easy to pay for things, simply wave your card and the purchase is completed. This convenience is great, but it puts us at risk of ID theft and fraud. This is a real hazard and a growing problem.

 

 

WARRANTY

We believe in our p BAG, and you should either. Even it is unexpected - if you are faced by any quality issue with manufacture or material during the first month, starting from the ship date, just send your p BAG back to us for repair or replacement. Under normal conditions and appropriate use, the p BAG should last you a lifetime.

YOUR SUPPORT

We need your support to ensure our first commercial production run. Your contributions will directly help us funding the booked production capacity at our partner’s factory, material costs, supply chain and logistics.

story:
SCOUT is a new generation of smart, easy, mobile power.

Recharge with Wall Socket or Micro USB Cable. Ultra Lightweight. Built-In Power Bank, Charge With Built-In Cables or 2.1 Amp USB Port.  No need to carry around messy cables or chargers to keep your iPhone, iPad, or Android fully charged.  

 

 

 

Future-proofed with a built-in AC Adapter, Power Bank, Three Built-in charging cables, and a USB A port that's compatible with all your current charging cables.  Choose the between the Scout Wireless for convenient wireless charging or the Scout Max for battery capacity.   Each model is fully compatible with iPhones, GoPro's, Cameras, Android Phones & Tablets.  

    Built-In Lighting, USB-C (for those new Android devices), and Micro-USB cables means you’ll never be without a cable to charge your device. When not in use, they are neatly tucked away and can simultaneously charge multiple devices.  Have your own cable for your iPhone?  No problem, a built-in USB port is compatible with all your current USB charging cables. 

    Never worry about carrying a cable. SCOUT has literally everything you need.

    SCOUT has enough juice to recharge your smartphone two to three times over without refueling. When it does need a boost, simply plug directly into a wall or connect to any power source via the Micro-USB input.

    The Scout is a compact power solution that will keep you going without weighing you down so you never have to worry about your device dying; whether you’re home, traveling, or off the grid.

    Chose the Scout + Solar Perk and as long as there’s sunlight, our Scout 10W Solar Panel can keep you charged. Designed around the concepts of redundancy and simplicity, the ultra-lightweight and durable solar panel keeps you charged without weighing you down. 

    The Scout 10W solar panel has a ridiculously lightweight hypalon shell.

    Designed with an emphasis on efficiency and simplicity originating in the harsh conditions of East Africa.

    Sports dual USB ports, smart charging control board, redundant internal wiring connection, and attachment points.  Will charge your Scout or any other device with a USB port.  

    Never worry about having that special cable or wall adapter for your iPhone, iPad, or Android device.  The Scout has all the built in cables you need to charge any of your devices, anywhere you go. 

     

     

    Scout is small, lightweight portable charger that has all the features you need. 

    Our mighty SCOUT packs a big punch. It replaces hundreds of dollars of gear in a single sleek and simple device.  Ditch the clutter and the chaos, and switch to a single device that does it all.

     

     

    What is Scout?

    Scout is the world’s best charger.  It features a built-in wall charger, built-in cables, quick-charging USB Port, and proprietary intelligent charging technology.  All this in an incredibly slim design that weighs in at less than 9 ounces.

    What is the difference between Scout Max and Scout Wireless?

    The Scout Max features a built-in wall charger, 9 independent charging cords that tuck neatly away, a universal USB port, additional micro USB charging port, and packs a 10000mAh battery for charging on the go. 

    The Scout Wireless has a 5000mAh battery and adds wireless charging to the mix, giving you an incredibly convenient way to charge. 

    Why did you develop Scout?

    These days, we all have so many devices and cords and chargers. Everything you buy seems to need more.  We got sick of the clutter and hassle and developed a single charger that could keep all our devices charged up. 

    Is the Scout a concept or are there working prototypes?  

    We have fully functional Scout prototypes are ready to move into mass production now.  Here is an unformatted video of the Scout prototype in action.  

    Can I charge my device while the Scout is plugged into the wall?  

    Absolutely, when plugged into the wall, Scout will simultaneously charge the internal power bank and any connected device.  There is also a micro USB input to charge Scout if an outlet isn’t handy or convenient. 

    Why do I need Scout?

    The Scout is an incredibly powerful charging platform that is easy to use, eliminates extra cords & chargers, and can go with you wherever you travel.

    Why are you crowdfunding? 

    Scout is a finished product, however we need your help to lower the cost for mass production. We also want to make sure our earliest supporters get the best pricing available, which is why the earlier you purchase, the better the deal!

    Will this carry all the necessary regulatory approvals such as ETL, FCC, and others?

    Yes, the Scout will be ETL certified and is FCC, RoHS, and CE compliant.  As an added layer of protection, we will be testing the internal battery to UL standards.
